programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: A frightening visit from a potential client puts a new case on the table and Cormoran Strike and Robin Ellacott set to work looking into reports of a strangled child. With their detective agency thriving, the duo are also recruited to investigate the blackmail of a government minister, with Robin going undercover in the House of Commons. The return of the crime thriller based on books by JK Rowling, starring Tom Burke and Holliday Grainger, with Robert Glenister and Robert Pugh

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Cormoran and Robin's startling discovery seems to confirm the story of the strangled child - but they're forced to leave the scene before they can properly investigate. Fearing their witness is in danger, they redouble their efforts to find him, leading them all over London in pursuit of the truth, from a derelict warehouse filled with protestors to a high-society charity fundraiser.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: World-weary detective inspector John Rebus goes on the trail of a copycat serial killer, only to be taken off the case pending an inquiry into the death of a convicted murderer he helped put behind bars 15 years earlier. Crime drama based on the books by best-selling author Ian Rankin, starring John Hannah, Jim Norton, Ewan Stewart, Sara Stewart and Joanna Roth

programme.title: Hattie
programme.desc: Ruth Jones stars as Carry On actress Hattie Jacques in this dramatisation of her secret affair with a younger man in the early 1960s, while still married to actor John Le Mesurier. A love triangle develops between the three and Hattie uses her charm and ingenuity to control escalating family tensions and threats of public exposure - but must ultimately make a decision that puts her at risk of being left on her own. Also starring Robert Bathurst, Aidan Turner and Jeany Spark

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's the day of the unveiling of the plaque in memory of the firebomb victims, but the event proves too much for guilty Des Taviner, who after another run-in with Sally Johnson, can't bring himself to deliver his speech. As a result, Sheelagh Murphy tells him they only have a future together if he can be honest with her

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Des Taviner finally tells Sheelagh Murphy the truth about starting the fire, so she gives him until the end of the day to confess all to his superiors. But soon after, a misunderstanding causes him to think she has betrayed him _ and he decides on a much more drastic course of action. Elsewhere, Gary Best manages to jeopardise a drugs raid involving his father, who offers himself as a hostage to save his son's neck

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As Dale Smith pulls Reg Hollis from the burning building, Tony Stamp tries to resuscitate the unconscious cop. The search is on for Gary Best's dad, who's been kidnapped by the drug dealers, and things look bleak when a bloodstained jacket is found. Polly Page's murder trial begins, and the prosecution immediately set out to make her look like a money-grabbing black widow

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The gunman who took Gary Best's dad is holed up in a building with two elderly residents, presenting Gina Gold with a dilemma when it turns out one of the OAPs is in urgent need of medical attention. But as she ponders whether to allow armed officers to storm the building, Dale Smith comes up with an alternative plan, offering himself in place of the hostages _ but can he persuade the armed madman to come quietly? Over at court, it's the last day of Polly Page's trial, and she takes the stand to convince the jury she was set up. But things don't look good, especially when the court hears how her version of events has changed three times so far

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Death comes to a Sun Hill regular. Long-running drama with the bobbies and detectives at the London-based police station

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Charity Wakefield and Hattie Morahan lead the cast in Andrew Davies's adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel about a voyage of sexual and romantic discovery. Following the death of her husband, Mrs Dashwood and her daughters are forced to give up their home and move to a small cottage in Devonshire. Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Colonel Brandon is called away on urgent business, leaving Marianne free to fall blissfully in love with Willoughby - until he too suddenly leaves for London. Meanwhile, Elinor has a disappointing meeting with Edward, but the reasons for his distant behaviour become clear when Sir John's niece Lucy Steele entrusts her with a shocking secret

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Marianne's health deteriorates as Colonel Brandon reveals the full extent of Willoughby's betrayal. Meanwhile, Edward states his intentions to honour his engagement to Lucy Steele, despite being disinherited by his mother as a result. Charity Wakefield and Dominic Cooper star

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Following the destruction of their home by the McGraths, Tilly and her grandmother are forced to live a life of solitude. Period drama, starring Carli Norris

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie befriends a patient during a delivery, but is troubled by the news that she has subsequently been readmitted to the Lady Emily after collapsing unexpectedly at home. Sister Frances decides she needs to know more of the outside world if she is truly to understand her patients' needs, and Cyril and Fred come to the aid of a family who have been evicted from their home - although Violet is less than happy about their acts of charity

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Pilot of the crime drama series, starring Martin Shaw as the eponymous 1960s detective who despairs at the corruption he witnesses around him and resolves to find the gangster who killed his wife, before hanging up his truncheon. Paired with a headstrong officer, Gently struggles in solving an increasingly complex case while keeping his partner on the straight and narrow. With Phil Davis

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Investigative reporter Maddy Magellan enlists the help of Jonathan Creek, who works as a creative consultant to a stage magician, in a bid to discover who is responsible for a painter's death. First episode of the mystery series, starring Alan Davies, Caroline Quentin, Anthony Head, Sheila Gish and Colin Baker

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim and the team investigate when a dismembered body is found under the floorboards of a Glasgow house. Things take a turn for the worse when the victim's nine-month-old baby is kidnapped from a multi-storey car park. Drama, starring Mark McManus, Neil Duncan, Harriet Buchan and Robert Robertson

programme.title: Damilola, Our Loved Boy
programme.desc: In November 2000, 10-year-old schoolboy Damilola Taylor was attacked and fatally wounded in Peckham, south London, a death that shocked the nation. This feature-length drama reveals the personal stories behind the headlines, exploring Damilola's journey from Lagos to London, and showing how Richard and Gloria Taylor coped with their personal lives as well as the pressure of the media as they fought for justice for the killing of their son. Babou Ceesay, Wunmi Mosaku and Sammy Kamara star, with Robert Pugh

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kelly realises honesty may not be the best policy. Will Dennis give Lisa the comfort she wants? Kat has to confront Andy

programme.desc: Beatrice considers her future with Jack and leaves Evie dumbfounded by accepting Larry Cotter's proposal to join forces and venture into ready-to-wear

programme.desc: Charlie Gimbert plots revenge, while Lovejoy and Lady Jane bicker over a royal dinner service belonging to a Belgian countess. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan

programme.desc: Tom helps a swimming instructor come to terms with a serious bowel condition which requires him to be fitted with a colostomy bag, and a meals-on-wheels driver recently passed fit by Will suffers a stroke at the wheel and nearly crashes into Kate, but refuses to be taken into a nursing home to aid his recovery. Medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd, Gray O'Brien and Maggie O'Neill

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Diana breaks Tom out of hospital, Harvey decides getting married will help him secure membership of the golf club, and Geoffrey believes his wife is evil

programme.desc: Bob wallows in self-pity, convinced he will never be able to cope without Thelma and increasingly worried about what the neighbours will think of Terry's home-making efforts. Starring Rodney Bewes, James Bolam and Brigit Forsyth

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy feels the need to do something special for the Queen's Silver Jubilee so he volunteers himself, Clegg, and Compo to help with the town's pageant. However, the need arises to find someone capable of driving a tractor. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg attends the funeral of an old friend, and later tries to convince Foggy and Compo that flowers have emotions and that they react to vocal tone and music. Compo's attention is more focused on his own needs, in particular enacting a new plan to drive Nora Batty into his arms. Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brain Wilde star

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Mike, Kristin, and Chalmers must determine who wanted a veterinary nurse dead, with the answer seemingly tied to simmering tensions between the twin sisters with whom the victim worked

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. programme.title: Silent Witness

programme.desc: Steve Brown guides a couple on a house hunt in Bedfordshire. He visits Biggleswade to find out about an accessible off road, multi-user path that circumnavigates the market town

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: On Zambia's plains, a cheetah mother must keep her cubs safe, preparing them for life without her. They take on dangerous prey and learn that even tiny neighbours can bite back

programme.title: Ghostbusters II (1989)
programme.desc: The eccentric spectre-hunters reunite to save New York from a massive river of slime generated by the citizens' negativity and nasty thoughts. Meanwhile, the spirit of a 16th-century tyrant tries to return to the land of the living by possessing the body of a toddler. Sequel to the supernatural comedy, starring Bill Murray, Sigourney Weaver, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis and Ernie Hudson

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Hamza Yassin are in Renfrewshire, joined by Edith Bowman, who will be the judge of this year's entries to the Countryfile photographic competition. John also meets Cyanotype artist Martha Orbach to uncover the origins of nature photography and visits a Glaswegian community collective. Hamza reveals a simple butterfly feeder to support wildlife, and Adam Henson has some tough decisions over what to grow after harvest

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Sefton Park Palm House in Liverpool, and discovers the history of the house. Finds include a rare double Ming Dynasty vase bought in a charity shop, some valuable Beatles memorabilia, a Grand Tour Bronze, some unusual Finnish glass, a painting by George Melly, and a silver disc brought in by one of the members of Gerry and the Pacemakers.

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: As the siege drags on in Tobruk, Harry leads a mission to find a source of drinking water. While they are successful in finding a well, tragedy strikes when they are caught out by a German ambush. In Manchester, Kasia is confronted by further horror of war when she discovers Irena's motives for spying for the Nazis. In France, romance blossoms between David and Henriette as they hide out in a farm

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Brentford v Tottenham Hotspur at Gtech Community Stadium and Chelsea v Liverpool at Stamford Bridge. Both previous meetings between Brentford and Spurs at this ground had ended level, while the last four contests involving the Blues and Liverpool in all competitions had been goalless. Plus, a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley visits Box Hill in Surrey to take on its zigzag cycle route - pitting himself against double Olympic gold medal-winning cyclist Joanna Rowsell Shand. Plus, there are clips from the Countryfile archives showcasing the best thrills and spills in the countryside

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood spends 24 hours working as a firefighter in Texas, but just getting the gear on in time is a tough job for him, let alone confronting his fear of heights

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A BMW driver is caught on camera dumping bags of rubbish in a fly-tipping hotspot, and pension regulators close in on a charity boss who helped himself to the company pension fund

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A tale of three mid-terraces finds Martel Maxwell in Nantwich, Cheshire, where an experienced development duo tackle a project. Martin Roberts is in Ironville just outside Nottingham to see a historic house in need of a refresh. Tommy Walsh is in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, where a young developer is taking charge for the first time under his father's supervision

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts from an antiques fair in Detling, Kent, and discovers treasures from the ancient past. The teams receive expert help from Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A baby sealion's birth is caught on camera. Plus, the story of an elephant who was rescued from the circus in poor health, and is now one of the park's oldest and fittest animals

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef heads out from Newquay to catch Cornish king crab, then goes to Bodmin Moor to meet explorer Robin Hanbury-Tenison to find out a rewilding project on his farm for which his son Merlin has recently introduced a pair of wild beavers

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Property relocation advice programme, beginning as Steve Brown helps a couple feeling the pinch of the London property market to decide on their ideal town and the right home in which to raise their young children by showing them around Knaresborough, North Yorkshire

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Digital embroider David is hoping Dom Chinea can help him find the success his pieces deserve. Novice woodworker Rachael is hoping to find the path to success

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1970s electric go-kart, a wooden puzzle box and a much-loved old teddy bear with a missing leg

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Featuring a bereaved mum trying to wrestle back control of her late son's social media accounts from a scammer, and the woman whose bank had no number for her to report a scam

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tommy and Alfie clash when Freddie lets slip who told him where to find Graham. Suki is jealous when a woman called Caz comes looking for Eve and Theo invites Stacey for a drink but is sad to discover she doesn't think of it as a date

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Lara Lewington speaks to some of the so-called godfathers of artificial intelligence about their hopes and fears for the future of a technology many believe could pose an existential threat to the human race. She also talks to researchers developing technology that allows computers to read human emotions and thoughts

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A creepy gift from Penderecki sets Jack off in a new direction. He negotiates with the Walking Man for more information, but he won't budge until Jack has found Bear's home. He warns Jack of people in the woods who don't take kindly to police. Honey takes control of his predicament following a visit from the police, only to find it is too late and that his troubles are only just beginning

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton joined by Jo Brand and Katy Balls

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a 10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show off their music knowledge are brothers Dave and Kenny from Glasgow, dad and daughter David and Aimee from Bangor, and married couple Eva and Shen from Beckenham

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Happy is determined to splash in a puddle

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels and Duggee hold an election

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea asks Broccoli for flying lessons, but doesn't let her know that she intends to fly high to take over Tato Tower

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and the flock attempt to rescue Timmy's favourite teddy from being sold

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Walter conspires to get Dennis thrown out of school

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Cat becomes obsessed with winning a soft toy at the arcade, but the greedy Smith twins are playing the games meant for little kids and winning every single prize

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A submarine is trapped and the Nektons launch an elaborate and dangerous rescue mission

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Bea from Hull needs a den where she can teach her sausage dog Stanley new tricks and they can be best buddies together

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: On an extremely hot day at the zoo, the white-cheeked gibbons enjoy a puzzling picnic, Spike the bearded dragon visits the vet, and there is a warm welcome set for Kyra the sun bear

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Social-media magician Magic Singh joins the team in the Blue Peter garden to show his tricks and teach you at home how to master magical card skills. Meanwhile, Joel and Mwaksy go on an off-road adventure to explore Iceland's volcanic landscape

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to Borneo, where he meets baby orang-utans and encounters a python on a night-time river expedition

programme.title: Mr Blandings Builds His Dream House (1948)
programme.desc: A city couple set out to build a home in the wilds of rural Connecticut. They discover they have bitten off more than they can chew thanks to a host of legal problems and an apparently endless stream of cowboy workmen and high-priced materials. Comedy, starring Cary Grant, Myrna Loy, Melvyn Douglas and Reginald Denny

programme.title: Live Women's Challenge Cup
programme.desc: Leeds Rhinos v St Helens (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the final at Wembley Stadium, as the teams meet in a repeat of last year's showpiece match, and the first to be held at this historic venue. The Saints are aiming to claim this trophy for the third season in a row, having triumphed 18-8 at Elland Road last year, and 34-16 at Leigh Sports Village in 2021

programme.title: The Wedding Planner (2001)
programme.desc: San Francisco wedding planner Mary Fiore organises other people's nuptials but has never had much luck in love. One day she is swept off her feet by handsome doctor Steve Edison. They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Marine biologist Mark Meakin follows tagged whale sharks, which can grow to more than 12 metres long, from the lagoons of Ningaloo in Western Australia to Christmas Island in the Indian Ocean, hoping to learn more about their movements and life cycle. In the process, he also gains valuable information on how they can be better protected

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Welsh Fire v Southern Brave (Start-time 6.00pm). Live coverage of the men's match at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. The Brave claimed victory in both of the fixtures between these teams last season, and recorded nine-wicket victories after batting second on each occasion. However, they only claimed one other win during the campaign, while Fire lost all eight of their matches, but both teams will be hoping for much improved seasons this time around

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A classic documentary from 1984 in which Arena took the American musicians Don and Phil Everly back to the coal-mining area of Kentucky where their father Ike had also formed an act and played the guitar alongside his brothers in the 1930s. In the moody atmosphere of Muhlenberg County, the stars have an emotional reunion with three generations of Everlys. With contributions by master musician and producer Chet Atkins, songwriters Felice and Boudleaux Bryant, and the legendary guitar singer Mose Rager

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The duo perform in a reunion concert in the autumn of 1983, staged at the Royal Albert Hall in London, which they chose because they had treasured memories of playing there with their father, Ike, a guitar virtuoso in his own right. The brothers' reconnection and subsequent live performance after 10 bitter years apart was such a high-profile event that the filming was fed live into the BBC Nine o'clock News. Arena's cameras proved that they and their unique sound could still capture the public's imagination

programme.title: Golf: The Women's Open
programme.desc: Highlights of day three of the Major Championship from Walton Heath in Surrey, which is staging this tournament for the first time. A seven-under-par round of 64 saw South Africa's Ashleigh Buhai rise to the top of the leaderboard at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament at Muirfield, ensuring she would go into the final day with a five-stroke lead

programme.title: The Everly Brothers: Harmonies from Heaven
programme.desc: Don and Phil - arguably the greatest harmony singers of all time - began as childhood musicians, performing hymns and country songs as Little Donnie and Baby Boy Phil on their father's radio shows in Iowa, where they grew up. This documentary follows Don back to the place where their love for music was formed to recall the music that was omnipresent in their home, the influence of their parents, the early radio shows and the musicians they played with in their formative years. Contributors include Art Garfunkel, Graham Nash, Dave Edmunds and Tim Rice

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and new co-presenter Rob Rinder go behind the scenes at some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world. Their first stop is Richard Branson's remote clifftop Kasbah Tamadot in Morocco, where they work alongside the staff to discover the significance of Berber hospitality, food and culture to their guests

programme.title: The Photograph (2020)
programme.desc: Michael, a reporter, becomes fascinated by a picture of a woman, and wants to know her backstory. In the present day, following the death of her estranged mother, a devastated young woman finds a photo that will change her life forever. Writer/director Stella Meghie's drama, starring Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield and Chelsea Peretti

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill gives viewers an update on her first garden, and shares a new structure designed especially for her compact plot. Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life. In the Cotswolds, Advolly Richmond showcases one of the finest examples of gardening in the arts and crafts era

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith return to Dumfries House where the Summer activities are in full swing. Matt discovers how Dumfries House is providing local people with ways to improve mental and physical wellbeing and joins a tea dance. Charlotte visits a craft workshop to try her hand at stained glass window making, and hears about plans to re-use, refurbish and re-engineer turbines

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Scott Smith demonstrates how to prune a rambling rose, while Kirsty Wilson checks up on her hot border, designed to be a riot of colour in high summer. Calum Clunie is at his allotment in Leven, where he's planting potaoes he will serve up for Christmas dinner

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: In May and June, the horticulturist plants sweet peas, picks the year's first salad leaves and stakes perennials into the ground. She also witnesses the blossoming of bluebells, primal ferns and oriental poppies, before she and her husband Neil take delivery of their first hive of honey bees

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The secret lives of the wildlife in the popular Cornish tourist attraction, set against the background of the gardening year. Charlie Hamilton James shoots footage highlighting a variety of creatures inhabiting the estate, including foxes at play in the pleasure gardens after the visitors have left, toads mating and the badgers that enter the tea rooms at night. Narrated by Philippa Forrester

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt takes a look back at some of his favourite recipes and best moments from Saturday Kitchen

programme.title: Strawbridge Over the Drawbridge
programme.desc: James Strawbridge visits Crom Castle, home of Lord and Lady Erne. On Upper Lough Erne James takes a trip on a unique type of boat - one that's both ferried schoolchildren and smuggled pigs across the border. Then, back on dry land, he takes a stroll under a pair of unique trees that were once home to lavish picnics and parties. After uncovering the castle's history, can he create a meal inspired by its past which impresses his hosts?

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Jez and Ieuz have one time for one last masterclass in Napoli before leaving for Parma. There they pick up a final sprinkling of parmesan, mix the most important batch of dough they will ever make and try to get a good night's sleep before the competition. Then destiny awaits as they face the best pizzaiolos on the planet at the Pizza World Championship

programme.title: Caribbean Food Made Easy
programme.desc: Levi Roots spices up ocean-fresh mackerel on a Cornwall beach, challenges loyal Cornish pasty eaters in Falmouth to try his golden vegetable patties and visits Bristol to taste a Caribbean twist on British favourite steak and chips

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of the women's road race, which starts at Loch Lomond and finishes in Glasgow. Annemiek van Vleuten of the Netherlands won this race last year in Australia, with Belgium's Lotte Kopecky finishing second and Silvia Persico of Italy completing the podium. The men's and women's BMX racing finals also take place at Glasgow Green, and there is action from the artistic cycling, cyclo-ball and road para-cycling team relay

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Fiona and Andy moved into their 300-year-old Solihull barn conversion a year ago, but it's not quite the fairy tale they imagined. The barn has a major identity crisis - with dated decor, a dark and poky stable conversion, a cut-off central courtyard and a 1980s extension tacked on the end. To add to their woes there's a spiral staircase right in the middle of the living room. Enter architects Laura Jane Clark and Julian McIntosh, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems - only one of which they can make a reality. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Million Dollar Wedding Planner
programme.desc: The exclusive world of Lelian Chew, who organises nuptials for the super-rich in the Far East, taking on 10 just ceremonies a year at an average cost of $1million each. Bespoke Cartier jewellery, hundreds of thousands of dollars of flowers and multiple designer wedding dresses are nothing out of the ordinary. But Lelian's job also involves navigating the clash between age-old Chinese marriage customs and the desires of the young, often with outlandish solutions - multiple weddings are becoming the norm for the Chinese super-rich

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The final leg of the journey takes in Morocco, where Simon visits a land borders between Africa and the European Union, and the coast of Spain, taking in the scale of the country's fruit and vegetable industry. He discovers why tourists are actively discouraged from visiting Corsica, and goes diving in waters that have the highest fish population in the Mediterranean

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder travel by seaplane to go behind the scenes of Joali hotel resort in the Maldives, which offers guests a luxury experience despite its remote location. Rob discovers there are 300 workers hidden in the centre of the island, while Monica finds out how food is supplied to the island chefs. They realise that delivering paradise is like a giant theatre production

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Former care worker Georgie is given the chance to list a 15 million house, but first she has to prove her business credentials to veteran broker Danny. Ex-model Vanesa lands a 15 million euro villa overlooking Monaco, but she needs to sell it before the end of the summer or the owner will take it off the market. With only 10 days to prepare she decides to throw an open house to gain some momentum, but will the bold decision pay off and land her with an offer?

programme.title: Ammonite (2020)
programme.desc: In the 1840s, renowned but overlooked fossil hunter Mary Anning lives a near-solitary existence with her mother in Lyme Regis. One day, amateur palaeontologist Roderick Murchison arrives in her shop with his invalid wife, asking to be allowed to learn her hunting techniques. When he departs on an expedition, he leaves Charlotte in Lyme,and asks Mary to keep an eye on his infirm wife. Historical biopic, starring Kate Winslet and Saoirse Ronan

programme.title: Golf: The Women's Open
programme.desc: Highlights of day four of the Major Championship from Walton Heath in Surrey, which was staging this tournament for the first time

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah visits Witley recycling centre in Surrey where she finds an Edwardian armchair, a dated display cabinet and a collection of costume jewellery for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford and Angela Rippon assess the performance of companies that offer multiple services in the name of ease and simplicity, as well as firms that could be doing a lot more to make life easier. Plus, legal expert Gary Rycroft helps out a man who is struggling to deal with his 'life admin' after a life-changing accident

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Jack delves deeper into the Donkey Pitch case, arranging a prison visit and listening to recordings of Lincoln interviewing Sophie and Hugo's classmates. When challenged by Lincoln, he reveals the secrets of his own past. Honey discovers CCTV cameras set up in the garden, and begins to suspect that he and Molina are pawns in someone's elaborate game

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Epsom in Surrey, where the reds and the blues are led by experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Plus, Eric heads to Wimbledon Common in the hope of finding out more about children's favourite the Wombles

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Hamza and the keepers get never-seen-before footage of inside the tigers' mouths in an effort to ascertain the state of their teeth. They also try to ascertain the animals' individual personality traits by onbserving the way they play with a ball. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive visits Bologna, considered by many to be Italy's food capital, where he leans to make perfect pasta and finds out why an osteria - an Italian wine bar - is superior to a pub. But it's not all food and drink as he also dons his hard hat and climbs some scaffolding to learn the history of an 800-year-old tower

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the city's gothic cathedral in November 1940. He visits the factory of the London Electric Vehicle Company, manufacturers of the iconic London taxi, and then heads south to Royal Leamington Spa and the national centre for the Guide Dogs for the Blind

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of the Russian Revolution, King Crimson, The Hunger Games, and the essays and journalism of George Orwell, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin hosts the antiques-buying challenge in which people are shown the tricks of the trade for buying and selling collectibles, before an auction showdown, with hairdresser Sarah facing off against civil servant Marika in Liverpool

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tom Westerland, Cindy Challoner and Andy Sheriden make their way to the kitchen for the Welsh heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. Tom creates a starter featuring a rabbit kiev, while Andy opts for a lamb belly dish inspired by the Welsh valleys. For her fish course, Cindy's dish features soused and grilled mackerel with beetroot and rhubarb

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his trawl through the National Archives, unearthing the secret war on the Rolling Stones, revealing how Special Branch spied on a future king. He also meets Oscar Wilde's grandson Merlin Holland to discuss the author's decline and fall from grace

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Documentary following zookeeper Giles Clark as he hand-rears Sumatran tiger cubs Spot and Stripe, which were born at the Australia Zoo in Queensland and are one of the world's most critically endangered species. To help give them the best start and ensure their survival, Giles takes them home to live with his boisterous family and gives them round-the-clock care for the first four months of their lives. The film gives an intimate look into the crucial early development of the cubs as they struggle through their first crucial weeks, while Giles embarks upon the toughest parenting job of his life and tries to save the species from the brink of extinction in the wild. Andrew Lincoln narrates

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Watts Gallery in Surrey, where experts Thomas Plant and David Harper are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farming couple Robert and Catherine sell their cider for the first time at Lenham Country Market in Kent, while seasoned beekeepers Vince and Sue create a buzz with their honey

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: James and Louisa take their Jersey cows to Edenbridge and Oxted Agricultural Show, while Jill brings along her finest goats for competing

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the beautiful and unique landscapes of the Lake District, beginning by meeting Cumbrians with different visions for the future of England's biggest national park. He talks to members of a campaign group trying to protect the remaining red squirrels, a traditional farmer who feels that his ancient way of life is on the point of extinction, and an 18-year-old student who runs a 1,500-acre farm

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as Matt Groening fans the Isotopes take on teachers the Academicals. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Loretta Lynch, Matthew Hopkins, Tim Davie, and Ban Ki-moon

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Amol Rajan asks the questions in another first-round match, with students from Emmanuel College, Cambridge pitting their wits against a team from Jesus College, Oxford in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Today, Earth is home to eight billion people and counting, with humans now having a greater effect in shaping Earth's surface than many natural processes. Chris Packham explores how dramatic twists in Earth's story enabled humans to go from being part of nature to controlling it and what can be learnt from this epic tale before it's too late

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: With his daughter Denise's wedding to Dave fast approaching, the arrival of a huge phone bill is the last thing Jim needs. First episode of the comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston, Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash and Ralf Little. First broadcast in 1998

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Piano (1993)
programme.desc: A mute Scottish widow travels to New Zealand with her daughter, and enters into a loveless arranged marriage. Her one means of self-expression is her piano, which her husband sells to a gruff settler who has adopted Maori culture. He allows her to play the instrument, and through their shared love of music, a passionate affair develops. Period drama, starring Oscar-winners Holly Hunter and Anna Paquin. With Harvey Keitel and Sam Neill

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith return to Dumfries House where the Summer activities are in full swing. Matt discovers how Dumfries House is providing local people with ways to improve mental and physical wellbeing and joins a tea dance. Charlotte visits a craft workshop to try her hand at stained glass window making, and hears about plans to re-use, refurbish and re-engineer turbines

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: As he investigates further, Jack becomes convinced the Donkey Pitch killer is still at large. In the house of horrors, Honey is paranoid they are being watched. Sophie's post-mortem reveals she was taking unprescribed antidepressants

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles and Mehreen Baig explore the south-western coastline of Scotland, with Mehreen taking to the skies with former RAF fighter pilot Archie Liggat, who is now using his skills to document large-scale pollution hidden along the coastline. Adrian, meanwhiile, visits Portpatrick to meet Calum Currie, who has persuaded his community to buy shares in the town's harbour - revitalising it for all who live there. Plus, Patrick Aryee joins volunteers help to track rare birdlife on the Ailsa Craig and Joe Lindsay visits an artists' colony that was the setting for cult film The Wicker Man

programme.title: Rome: A History of the Eternal City
programme.desc: Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore reveals how Rome cast aside its pantheon of pagan gods, and Emperor Constantine took a huge leap of faith by promoting Christianity as the religion of the empire. He charts the rocky course of Rome's rise to become the capital of Western Christendom, and its impact on the lives of its citizens, elites and high priests

programme.title: Clean Sweep
programme.desc: Jason reminds Shelly to attend the police station for fingerprinting and DNA testing - so she goes to extreme lengths to change make sure her records won't match. Glencara houskeeper Eileen gives a description of the woman seen leaving the dead man's room, while the investigation in London is developing new leads - despite political pressure to close the case

programme.title: Clean Sweep
programme.desc: Shelly faces mounting pressure after being identified as the mysterious woman at the crime scene. She contemplates escape, but her love for her children prevails and she decides to stay put. Crime thriller, starring Charlene McKenna

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 1980 drama, starring Sam Waterston. The year is 1938 and Robert Oppenheimer, physics professor at Berkeley, California, is heavily involved with his students, politics and scientific work, when the discovery of nuclear fission and the appearance of Kitty Harrison combine to change the course of his life. With Jana Shelden and Kate Harper

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: With America now fully involved in the war, Oppenheimer has given up teaching and is engaged in the race against Germany to produce an atomic bomb. Starring Sam Waterston, David Suchet and Edward Hardwicke. From 1980

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank has problems with a hi-tech toilet while staying with his brother-in-law, but the bungler's attempts to put it right result in more than a few crossed wires. Slapstick comedy, starring Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker settles into his new job as Minister for Administrative Affairs, ably assisted - and hindered - by civil servants Bernard Woolley and Sir Humphrey Appleby. First episode of the comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: A keen MP is appointed to the Department of Social Affairs and Citizenship in a Cabinet reshuffle, but she was so far down the food chain that spin doctor Malcolm Tucker did not have a file on her. It also turns out that she has expensive ideas and is about to face the media at a crucial by-election poster launch. Political comedy, starring Peter Capaldi, Rebecca Front and Chris Addison

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles and Mehreen Baig explore the south-western coastline of Scotland, with Mehreen taking to the skies with former RAF fighter pilot Archie Liggat, who is now using his skills to document large-scale pollution hidden along the coastline. Adrian, meanwhiile, visits Portpatrick to meet Calum Currie, who has persuaded his community to buy shares in the town's harbour - revitalising it for all who live there. Plus, Patrick Aryee joins volunteers help to track rare birdlife on the Ailsa Craig and Joe Lindsay visits an artists' colony that was the setting for cult film The Wicker Man

programme.title: The Joy of Mozart
programme.desc: Tom Service travels to Vienna and Salzburg in Austria to examine the life and times of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. He explores the key cities and rooms in which the 18th-century composer lived and worked, and is given the opportunity to play some of his original instruments and scores before learning about his tragic death at 35 years old. Contributors include John Eliot Gardiner, Nicola Benedetti and Paul Morley

programme.title: Felix Klieser Plays Mozart at the Proms
programme.desc: Virtuoso horn player Felix Klieser, who was born without arms and plays the instrument with his toes, makes his Proms debut with Mozart's Concerto No 4, with the Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Kirill Karabits. The orchestra also perform Rachmaninov's Second Symphony on what would have been the composer's 150th birthday, and the concert opens with music by the conductor's father - Ivan Karabits' first Concerto for Orchestra. Written to mark the 1,500th anniversary of the founding of Kyiv it's a colourful orchestral soundscape evoking chiming bells and a city in happier times. Presented by Petroc Trelawny, joined by Hannah French

programme.title: Eisteddfod
programme.desc: Sian heads to the Llyn peninsula to bring all the highlights and stories from the National Eisteddfod of Wales and to discover how this most ancient of festivals is constantly evolving to remain a relevant cultural force. She brings a flavour of the diverse selection of performances - from brass bands to classy pop performances to classical and contemporary music. Featuring N'famady Kouyate, voted best newcomer in Glastonbury, and the Welsh of the West End, who became a viral sensation during the pandemic. Sian also catches up with the makers of this year's Crown and Chair, accolades awarded to the main literary prize-winners

programme.title: Eisteddfod
programme.desc: Sian presents her second visit to the week-long festival, catching up with a host of celebrities who have been inducted into the ancient Gorsedd of the Bards. She pops behind the scenes to Maes B - the Eisteddfod's little brother, where the youth flock to hear the best Welsh contemporary music - and attends the circus and fire crescendo which closes the festival

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski explores the revolution that occurred when Einstein's theory of relativity turned Newton's elegant description of the universe inside out

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski looks back at the industrial and political revolutions of the 18th century, when the forces of nature were harnessed and the basis of political power was shifted. Human inventiveness came to full flower with the Industrial Revolution, which Bronowski claims was every bit as significant as the Renaissance

programme.title: In Conversation
programme.desc: The actress discusses her life and career in an interview recorded at the British Film Institute Southbank, from her movie debut in Educating Rita through roles in Billy Elliot, Calendar Girls and Paddington. Presented by Richard E Grant, who in 2006 cast Walters in his semi-autobiographical directorial debut Wah-Wah. First broadcast in 2015

programme.title: Doris Day: I Don't Even Like Apple Pie
programme.desc: In conversation with Christopher Frayling, Doris Day looks back over her successful acting and singing career, and recalls happy memories of working with Rock Hudson, James Cagney, Clark Gable and James Garner. First broadcast in 1989

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part one of two. Anita Rani examines the stories of four British families, one Muslim, one Hindu, one Colonial and her own Sikh one, who lived in India at the time of Partition in 1947, when the country was divided and created the new nation of Pakistan. They travel for the first time to the homes in Pakistan, India and Bangladesh that their relatives fled in terror, meeting long-lost family friends, and neighbours of other religions who shielded their families at huge personal risk

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through New Mexico, watching rehearsals at the Santa Fe Opera House and learning about a Lancashire railroad caterer who made his fortune. He then sets off from Albuquerque to pick up Arizona's Grand Canyon Railway as heads off to witness one of the greatest sights on Earth

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Just outside Leicester, Alice joins a team of archaeologists who are investigating a mysterious mound thought to be an Iron Age hillfort, but what they unearth tells a rich story of bandits, religious crusades and connections across the medieval world. Elsewhere in Cambridge, the dig diary cameras are present to witness archaeologists unearthing an extraordinary array of exquisite artefacts from an early Anglo-Saxon cemetery

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part two of two. Anita Rani begins her own Partition journey, as she and her mother Lucky become the first members of her family to return to see what is now Pakistan, since the Partition of India. In the Punjabi village where her Sikh grandfather's first family were slaughtered, Anita meets locals who were eye witnesses to the terrible event. Across the border, Sameer Butt re-traces the epic train journey across the Punjab to Pakistan, and Binita Kane explores how her Hindu family managed to escape the violence that engulfed their Bengali village

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: An investigation into the science of black holes and the techniques being used to uncover their secrets, which in turn help to answer even bigger questions about the universe

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an update to the original series. Six years on from the investigation and conviction, the Supreme Court of Israel orders a retrial and Zadorov tells his story for the first time

programme.title: Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston explores the forensic advances that have elevated murder weapons from mere instruments to crucial pieces of evidence. She sees how arsenic, the undetectable weapon of choice in the 19th century, was exposed as the killer thanks to one simple chemical test, and finds out how distinctive marks on a victim's skull led to the weapon and, in turn, the killer. Gabriel also looks at the latest forensic developments, from 3-D laser scanning that can reconstruct the sequence of events at the scene of a gun crime to the pioneering chemistry able to determine where in the world someone has been based on just a few strands of their hair

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski explores the revolution that occurred when Einstein's theory of relativity turned Newton's elegant description of the universe inside out

programme.desc: When a strange, lumpy, green ball rolls to their feet, Fred and Pete are sure they've found treasure. But what is it? At the Museum of Cornish Treasures, Archie tells them that their treasure grew up in Cornwall under a big dome, and Suzy sends them to the Eden Project to find out more. Here, they meet Catherine who says their treasure is a type of fruit from a place far away. But how did the fruit get to Cornwall? Suzy buzzes on the Treasure Comm and suggests Fred and Pete take a trip on a zip wire and explore the tropical dome. They meet Catherine again who reveals their treasure is a screw pine fruit. This fruit is usually found in hot countries in Asia and Africa but is able to grow in Edens dome because it's so warm inside. Catherine takes Fred and Pete on a plant hunt around the tropical dome. Catherine explains how fruits produce seeds which then grow into new trees that produce fruits themselves

Today we meet lots of hedgehogs - a brown hedgehog, a small hedgehog, a snuffling hedgehog and a hungry hedgehog! Dee meets a prickly hedgehog, a helpful hedgehog and a hula-hooping hedgehog. The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dee's friend finally succeeds in saying today's word!

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome little ones Dionne, Holly, Reau, Francis, Oliver and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Nigels bag are a red skittle, a red fire engine toy and a red ball, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that are red. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding a safe, baby appropriate red toy or object inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The popular baby song Little Robin Redbreast features, as does a story involving Baby Bear and Baby Tiger, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring red things too. The Action Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: School of Roars

Chantelle meets some schoolchildren, and they look for a devils coach horse beetle in their fantastic nature garden, whilst Rory heads into the woods to meet a beetle expert. Chantelle and Rorys fact files help explain all of Micheal's questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem, we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, devil's coach horse beetles are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Chantelle and the children put their noses to the test with a supersmelly challenge!

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Ted wants to camp out in the garden, and with sister Sofias help he puts up a tent for them both to sleep in. Dads in charge of the barbecue and cooks up a yummy camping feast of hot dogs and toasted marshmallows. Before they settle down for a night in the great outdoors, Ted and his family talk about some of the nocturnal animals they may hear during the night.

programme.title: My World Kitchen

programme.title: Maddie, Space and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie as she finds out how space rockets work and how they take astronauts into space. We discover how thrust and rocket fuel work, when a rocket engine blasts off from the launch pad and into space, and learn about the different parts of the rocket and what they are for. Next, we find out about the special computers on-board that guide astronauts through space, and Maddie rides a very fast rollercoaster to show us how G-force works when a rocket launches. Finally, we find out how a rocket lands safely to bring the astronauts back to Earth.

Then, theres a healthy eating quiz based on the food groups that make up a balanced diet. Finally, the teams must make their way across a giant inflatable version of the solar system. programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Fred and Pete find a heavy metal thing buried in the sand on the beach. Its got little windows in, and as Fred discovers, its full of gunky seaweed. But what is it? Its time to head back to the museum to see what Suzy and Archie make of it. Archie reveals that this object will keep you safe and sound, while Suzy finds a photo of a friend of hers with a big metal object just like the one Fred and Pete found. She sends them back to the beach to meet him. Fred and Pete arrive on the beach and are startled to see what looks like an alien with a metal object just like theirs, walking up to them. The alien is actually Suzy's friend Iain, and he explains that the metal object on his head is a helmet for a very old-fashioned deep sea diving suit. Fred and Pete then wonder what divers do when theyre underwater. Suzy sends them to the other end of the beach to meet Hannah from the Cornish Diving Centre, who tells them about modern diving equipment and how they use it. Hannah invites Fred

The preparations for this milestone event take Ivor on a trip down memory lane - to the area where he grew up, the market where he worked for 40 years, and the grave of his beloved wife. Now he's happily living with his new partner of 12 years, Rita, the bar mitzvah is the perfect opportunity to take stock of his life and make the most of growing older

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher reveals the secrets of farmers and food producers as he explore Wales' best food festivals. He starts out with a visit to the Abergavenny Food Festival, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tommy and Alfie clash when Freddie lets slip who told him where to find Graham. Suki is jealous when a woman called Caz comes looking for Eve and Theo invites Stacey for a drink but is sad to discover she doesn't think of it as a date

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Lara Lewington speaks to some of the so-called godfathers of artificial intelligence about their hopes and fears for the future of a technology many believe could pose an existential threat to the human race. She also talks to researchers developing technology that allows computers to read human emotions and thoughts

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A creepy gift from Penderecki sets Jack off in a new direction. He negotiates with the Walking Man for more information, but he won't budge until Jack has found Bear's home. He warns Jack of people in the woods who don't take kindly to police. Honey takes control of his predicament following a visit from the police, only to find it is too late and that his troubles are only just beginning

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max has discovered that someone has been stealing Diazepam, and proposes new rules to restrict access - a move that threatens to cut off Faith's supply and bring her secrets into the light. When Cam forgets to sign for a patient's morphine, Stevie becomes suspicious that he is behind the missing drugs. Donna's conscience is troubled further when a familiar patient is checked in

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Vita's musical career continues to blossom following her performance in Jamaica, but Yemi warns that the price of success may be turning her back on her dysfunctional family. Dawn demands to know where all Bosco's money has gone, forcing Beres to admit the truth - the Champion Crown contract grants him complete control of all his son's future earnings

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Nottingham Forest at Emirates Stadium and Brighton & Hove Albion v Luton Town at AMEX Stadium. Last season's runners-up Arsenal invested heavily in the summer on the likes of Declan Rice and Kai Havertz, and will have expected to get off to a winning start. Meanwhile, Championship play-off winners Luton made their Premier debut against a team that impressed last term. Plus, Burnley v Manchester City, Bournemouth v West Ham United, Everton v Fulham, Newcastle United v Aston Villa and Sheffield United v Crystal Palace

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Steven Thompson presents action from the latest fixtures, including Rangers v Livingston, Hearts v Kilmarnock and Motherwell v Hibernian

programme.title: Highlander (1986)
programme.desc: A 16th-century Scottish clansman discovers he is one of a race of immortal warriors who can only be killed by beheading, and who are destined to fight to the death until just one survives. Centuries later in modern-day New York, he prepares for a final showdown with his deadliest enemy. Fantasy action adventure, starring Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Clancy Brown and Roxanne Hart. Featuring a soundtrack by Queen

programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Nottingham Forest at Emirates Stadium and Brighton & Hove Albion v Luton Town at AMEX Stadium. programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Cameras follow Ivor as he celebrates his 83rd birthday by having a second bar mitzvah, which happens to coincide with his 13-year-old grandson Zak's first bar mitzvah. The preparations for this milestone event take Ivor on a trip down memory lane - to the area where he grew up, the market where he worked for 40 years, and the grave of his beloved wife. Now he's happily living with his new partner of 12 years, Rita, the bar mitzvah is the perfect opportunity to take stock of his life and make the most of growing older

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Four friends take on a terraced house in Crewe. A former shop in the Cumbrian village of Glasson and a three bedroom terraced house in Gnosall in Staffordshire are also refurbished

programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Newark, Nottinghamshire, with experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. Featuring a look at the profitable field of police memorabilia

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum visits the historical and religious sites of Colchester, Britain's oldest recorded town since its foundation during the Roman occupation of Britain over 2000 years. Laura Wright visits FACT (Fellowship Afloat Christian Trust) and finds out how, using outdoor activities, they provide a space to reach young people, who might not come into contact with traditional church life

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At Walsall Recycling Centre in the West Midlands, Jay Blades finds a pair of chairs, a collection of metal racks and drawers, a school desk and a collection of brass lighting

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown guides a couple on a house hunt in Bedfordshire. He visits Biggleswade to find out about an accessible off road, multi-user path that circumnavigates the market town

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: On Zambia's plains, a cheetah mother must keep her cubs safe, preparing them for life without her. They take on dangerous prey and learn that even tiny neighbours can bite back

programme.title: Ghostbusters II (1989)
programme.desc: The eccentric spectre-hunters reunite to save New York from a massive river of slime generated by the citizens' negativity and nasty thoughts. Meanwhile, the spirit of a 16th-century tyrant tries to return to the land of the living by possessing the body of a toddler. Sequel to the supernatural comedy, starring Bill Murray, Sigourney Weaver, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis and Ernie Hudson

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Hamza Yassin are in Renfrewshire, joined by Edith Bowman, who will be the judge of this year's entries to the Countryfile photographic competition. John also meets Cyanotype artist Martha Orbach to uncover the origins of nature photography and visits a Glaswegian community collective. Hamza reveals a simple butterfly feeder to support wildlife, and Adam Henson has some tough decisions over what to grow after harvest

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Sefton Park Palm House in Liverpool, and discovers the history of the house. Finds include a rare double Ming Dynasty vase bought in a charity shop, some valuable Beatles memorabilia, a Grand Tour Bronze, some unusual Finnish glass, a painting by George Melly, and a silver disc brought in by one of the members of Gerry and the Pacemakers.

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: As the siege drags on in Tobruk, Harry leads a mission to find a source of drinking water. While they are successful in finding a well, tragedy strikes when they are caught out by a German ambush. In Manchester, Kasia is confronted by further horror of war when she discovers Irena's motives for spying for the Nazis. In France, romance blossoms between David and Henriette as they hide out in a farm

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Brentford v Tottenham Hotspur at Gtech Community Stadium and Chelsea v Liverpool at Stamford Bridge. Both previous meetings between Brentford and Spurs at this ground had ended level, while the last four contests involving the Blues and Liverpool in all competitions had been goalless. Plus, a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Aberdeen v Celtic. Extended action from the clash at Pittodrie, plus a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley visits Box Hill in Surrey to take on its zigzag cycle route - pitting himself against double Olympic gold medal-winning cyclist Joanna Rowsell Shand. Plus, there are clips from the Countryfile archives showcasing the best thrills and spills in the countryside

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood spends 24 hours working as a firefighter in Texas, but just getting the gear on in time is a tough job for him, let alone confronting his fear of heights

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A BMW driver is caught on camera dumping bags of rubbish in a fly-tipping hotspot, and pension regulators close in on a charity boss who helped himself to the company pension fund

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A tale of three mid-terraces finds Martel Maxwell in Nantwich, Cheshire, where an experienced development duo tackle a project. Martin Roberts is in Ironville just outside Nottingham to see a historic house in need of a refresh. Tommy Walsh is in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, where a young developer is taking charge for the first time under his father's supervision

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts from an antiques fair in Detling, Kent, and discovers treasures from the ancient past. The teams receive expert help from Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A baby sealion's birth is caught on camera. Plus, the story of an elephant who was rescued from the circus in poor health, and is now one of the park's oldest and fittest animals

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef heads out from Newquay to catch Cornish king crab, then goes to Bodmin Moor to meet explorer Robin Hanbury-Tenison to find out a rewilding project on his farm for which his son Merlin has recently introduced a pair of wild beavers

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Property relocation advice programme, beginning as Steve Brown helps a couple feeling the pinch of the London property market to decide on their ideal town and the right home in which to raise their young children by showing them around Knaresborough, North Yorkshire

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Digital embroider David is hoping Dom Chinea can help him find the success his pieces deserve. Novice woodworker Rachael is hoping to find the path to success

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1970s electric go-kart, a wooden puzzle box and a much-loved old teddy bear with a missing leg
