programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley visits Box Hill in Surrey to take on its zigzag cycle route - pitting himself against double Olympic gold medal-winning cyclist Joanna Rowsell Shand. Plus, there are clips from the Countryfile archives showcasing the best thrills and spills in the countryside

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood spends 24 hours working as a firefighter in Texas, but just getting the gear on in time is a tough job for him, let alone confronting his fear of heights

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A BMW driver is caught on camera dumping bags of rubbish in a fly-tipping hotspot, and pension regulators close in on a charity boss who helped himself to the company pension fund

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A tale of three mid-terraces finds Martel Maxwell in Nantwich, Cheshire, where an experienced development duo tackle a project. Martin Roberts is in Ironville just outside Nottingham to see a historic house in need of a refresh. Tommy Walsh is in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, where a young developer is taking charge for the first time under his father's supervision

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts from an antiques fair in Detling, Kent, and discovers treasures from the ancient past. The teams receive expert help from Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A baby sealion's birth is caught on camera. Plus, the story of an elephant who was rescued from the circus in poor health, and is now one of the park's oldest and fittest animals

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef heads out from Newquay to catch Cornish king crab, then goes to Bodmin Moor to meet explorer Robin Hanbury-Tenison to find out a rewilding project on his farm for which his son Merlin has recently introduced a pair of wild beavers

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Property relocation advice programme, beginning as Steve Brown helps a couple feeling the pinch of the London property market to decide on their ideal town and the right home in which to raise their young children by showing them around Knaresborough, North Yorkshire

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Digital embroider David is hoping Dom Chinea can help him find the success his pieces deserve. Novice woodworker Rachael is hoping to find the path to success

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1970s electric go-kart, a wooden puzzle box and a much-loved old teddy bear with a missing leg

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Featuring a bereaved mum trying to wrestle back control of her late son's social media accounts from a scammer, and the woman whose bank had no number for her to report a scam

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tommy and Alfie clash when Freddie lets slip who told him where to find Graham. Suki is jealous when a woman called Caz comes looking for Eve and Theo invites Stacey for a drink but is sad to discover she doesn't think of it as a date

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Lara Lewington speaks to some of the so-called godfathers of artificial intelligence about their hopes and fears for the future of a technology many believe could pose an existential threat to the human race. She also talks to researchers developing technology that allows computers to read human emotions and thoughts

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A creepy gift from Penderecki sets Jack off in a new direction. He negotiates with the Walking Man for more information, but he won't budge until Jack has found Bear's home. He warns Jack of people in the woods who don't take kindly to police. Honey takes control of his predicament following a visit from the police, only to find it is too late and that his troubles are only just beginning

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: Documentary following the regulars at a West Belfast bingo hall, as they prepare for one of the busiest nights of the year - when the prize money rises to four figures. Among the players are Eilish, who learned the game at her grandmother's knee while in her teens, Margaret, who is juggling her job, her children, a college course, and her husband's health problems, and Kate, who is preparing to celebrate a friend's birthday

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton joined by Jo Brand and Katy Balls

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a 10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show off their music knowledge are brothers Dave and Kenny from Glasgow, dad and daughter David and Aimee from Bangor, and married couple Eva and Shen from Beckenham

programme.title: Take Me to the Opera
programme.desc: Zeinab Badawi meets Sir Bryn Terfel, one of the most distinguished singers of our age. A star who is in demand on stages across the world, Bryn has stayed true to his Welsh roots and is a great proponent for Welsh culture. He invites Zeinab behind the scenes not only at the Royal Opera House where he is a regular performer, but also in his native Wales where he still lives and where he is recording an album of traditional folk songs. He was chosen personally by King Charles to sing at his coronation. Zeinab visits the Welsh National Opera which launched Bryn's international career and speaks to WNO general director, Aidan Lang who oversaw his debut performance. The WNO's touring wardrobe manager Judith Russell, shows Zeinab Sir Bryn's costume as Falstaff in the opera by Verdi and explains how she was tasked with dressing him for this iconic role. We meet young Welsh singers performing at the same local singing competitions that Bryn sang in as a young boy and ask how he inspires them t

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: All That Lies Behind Me (Sgeulachd Donald Merrett)
programme.desc: Using dramatic reconstructions and expert opinion, John Morrison revisits the story of John Donald Merrett - a murderer who, having been cleared of killing his mother in 1927, spent the next 30 years on a spree across Europe, spending a large inheritance on women and the black market. The programme also reveals how when Merrett returned to Britain, he killed his wife and mother-in-law, before committing suicide

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: When the Emir's son is saved from Muller, the detectives swallow pills for their headaches. They are not headache tablets but Formula Fourteen - pills used to sabotage the world's oil supply

programme.title: An Solas Buan (Lighthouses of Scotland)
programme.desc: The work of lighthouse architects Tom and David Stevenson, whose designs moved more toward functionality and away from the fancy flourishes that characterised their predecessors. Examples of their work include Muckle-Flugga - Britain's most northerly lighthouse - and the magnificent rock light off the west coast of Mull at Dubh Artach

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Joy Dunlop meets learner and musician Teya-Jean Bawden, who lives near Beauly, and Calum Maclean goes in search of some tasty matchday treats in Kilmarnock

programme.title: Rum Gu Rum, Le Erica

programme.title: Trusadh (Compelling Stories)
programme.desc: Broadcaster Cathy Macdonald talks to sons and daughters of the manse, who were brought up during a time when the church had far-reaching influence. She speaks to the Rev Iver Martin, who followed in his father's footsteps and became a minister, and who is now the Moderator of the Free Church of Scotland

programme.title: Bannan (The Ties That Bind)
programme.desc: Miri becomes suspicious that someone close to her is to blame for what happened to Sarah Jane, when he believes him to be acting suspiciously. Meanwhile, sparks fly and things heat up between some of the locals in the community

programme.title: Cinema Gadelica
programme.desc: How film-makers have been drawn to the Highlands and Islands to shoot amid the spectacular scenery of the Gaidhealtachd. Discover James Bond's Glencoe birthplace, as revealed in Skyfall. Join Harry Potter on his way to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry via the Glenfinnan Viaduct, and set out on Ridley Scott's Prometheus to discover the origins of humankind - starting the mission at the Quiraing in Skye

programme.title: Mach Seo!
programme.desc: A trip to Aberdeenshire takes Ramsay MacMahon to vast beaches and ruined coastal castles, including Slains Castle at Cruden Bay, where he walks in Bram Stokers footsteps

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd finds a discarded leg behind the washing machine, he is mistakenly declared a hero for defeating a bloodthirsty spider. Unable to resist the praise and free comics, Lloyd goes along with it... but he's then confronted by an actual spider.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When the wasp steals the sweetie and takes it to their nest, Lloyd then gathers a team to stage a sweet-retrieving heist!

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. Goliath the dog, the terror of the park who is feared by all homeless animals, finds an adversary stronger than himself: a creature with a black coat and luminescent eyes that stands on its hind legs like a werewolf.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Australia v France or Morocco (Kick-off 8.00am). Coverage of the third quarter-final, which takes place at Lang Park in Brisbane, Australia. The co-hosts finished top of a group containing Republic of Ireland, Canada and Nigeria and overcame Denmark 2-0 in the last 16. The French also topped their group ahead of Jamaica, Brazil and Panama and comfortably overcame Morocco 4-0 last time out. Seema Jaswal presents, with analysis from Karen Carney and Jen Beattie, and commentary by Pien Meulensteen and Lucy Ward

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James meets food critic and broadcaster Grace Dent in Birmingham, taking a trip down the 35-mile canal system in a narrowboat and cooking his version of chicken balti

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: England v Colombia (Kick-off 11.30am). Coverage of the fourth quarter-final which takes place at Stadium Australia in Sydney. After topping a group containing Denmark, China and Haiti, England were pushed to the limit by Nigeria in the last 16 before progressing on penalties, and they will now be without one of their star players in Lauren James due to suspension after she was sent off in that match. Colombia won their group ahead of Morocco, Germany and South Korea and edged past Jamaica 1-0 in the previous round. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Karen Carney and Eni Aluko pitchside reports by Katie Shanahan, Ian Wright and Jill Scott, and commentary by Emma Hayes and Seb Hutchinson

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ainsley's World Cup Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by football pundit Jermaine Jenas and actress and TV presenter Denise Van Outen, , and makes dishes inspired by Brazil and Portugal, with sticky pork and smoky bean tacos and a buttermilk peri-peri chicken burger

programme.title: Big (1988)
programme.desc: A boy ridiculed for his size makes a wish on a fairground machine to become bigger - only to wake up as a 30-year-old man. Driven from his home by his terrified mother, the bewildered youngster trapped in a grown-up body makes his way to New York, where he rises high in the ranks of a toy manufacturing company and applies his youthful enthusiasm to the complexities of adult life. Comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Elizabeth Perkins and Robert Loggia

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Great Yarmouth in Norfolk for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. Twins Claire and Racheal want to win enough to send their parents off for their dream holiday, Patricia and her son Ciaran hope to pay for a road trip around America, and Debs and her husband Hong wish for enough to treat their friends and family

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond achieves his '00' status and is dispatched on the trail of Le Chiffre, an international criminal financing terrorist organisations around the world. Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack

programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Disaster! Mo is unwittingly recorded on the school's surveillance camera while using a power. Fortunately for our duo, Mo isn't recognisable on the video. But Brick is feverish, he's utterly determined to find out who's behind this 'supernatural being'. Mo and Sam manage to keep their identity secret, but HORRORS! JC announces he is the superhero on camera! He declares his 'superhero' name is 'Swatteroo The Sublime' and that he's gifted with astonishing super powers.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team make over a family garden in south Wales, for the benefit of father-of-three Chris Garlick, who lost his hands and feet to sepsis just 22 months earlier. Katie Rushworth creates a contemporary water-feature-cum-bench that would look good in any garden and Frances Tophill shows how soft naturalistic planting with the emphasis on scent can create the perfect garden for wellness

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the final of the celebrity cookery series, as the three remaining stars face their toughest challenge yet in a bid to walk off with the title. The stakes are high, and only one will be crowned this year's winner

programme.desc: Politician Evan Baxter is recruited by God for a special mission. A great flood is coming, and like Noah before him, Evan has to build an ark to protect the wildlife of the world from the impending cataclysm. However, convincing others that the end is nigh proves difficult. Comedy sequel to Bruce Almighty, starring Steve Carell, John Goodman, Lauren Graham and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)
programme.desc: James Bond joins forces with a Chinese agent to foil a media mogul's scheme to start a war between their countries - a case complicated by the fact that an old flame is now married to his new enemy. Using an undetectable stealth ship, the press baron plans to launch an undetectable sneak attack on both nations' navies, knowing they will blame each other - giving him exclusive global media coverage of the resulting conflict. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce, Teri Hatcher and Michelle Yeoh

programme.title: The Real Spies Among Friends
programme.desc: Documentary examining the true story behind ITV thriller A Spy Among Friends, which is based on Ben Macintyre's book about Kim Philby and his fellow traitors in the Cambridge spy ring. From Cold War Washington DC to contemporary Moscow, and from Beirut backstreets to the salons of Buckingham Palace, this story is as gripping as any fictional thriller

programme.title: A Spy Among Friends
programme.desc: Elliott's four-day debrief of Philby in Beirut ends with a painful personal truth for him and their final confrontation reveals the complex emotional reasons why he let the double agent escape. Elliott and Lily come to understand that their suspicions of Hollis are a construct of the now invisible hand of Philby and must therefore be questioned and treated with caution before they cripple British Intelligence

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men hoping to find birth family. Joe McGregor was adopted as a baby in Bermuda in the 1970s and grew up in Norfolk in a loving family, yet he still yearns to find his birth family. Simon Miller's mum's dying wish was that he should find the daughter who she gave up for adoption just a few years before he was born

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.desc: Bob is still angry about Liam and Wendy - with devastating results. The villagers are in a state of shock, leaving Wendy and Liam feeling guilty

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Stephen aims to retrieve some incriminating evidence. Gemma feels out of her depth in her new job. The Bailey men discuss a new business enterprise. Lauren makes a fool of herself in front of Max and Roy

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men, both of them born in Ireland to unmarried mothers at a time when having children outside of marriage was seen as sinful and the Catholic Church went to great lengths to cover it up. When Arthur Fitzharris's adoptive parents died he decided to find out about his birth family, and was dismayed to discover that his birth certificate falsely recorded early foster parents as though they were his biological parents. Bernard McGrath discovered his adoptive parents were falsely named as his biological parents on his birth certificate and no other records seemed available to him

programme.title: The Ipcress File
programme.desc: In 1962 Berlin, British Army corporal Harry Palmer is released from military prison at the behest of unorthodox spymaster Dalby, who wants him to help find an abducted scientist critical to the creation of a new bomb to scare the Soviet Union. Cold War spy thriller adapted by John Hodge from the Len Deighton novel, starring Joe Cole, with Lucy Boynton and Tom Hollander

programme.title: The Ipcress File
programme.desc: As he heads with Jean to the nuclear weapons research lab, Harry spots a suspicious stranger on their tail who is later identified as a former agent now working for anyone who will pay him. The chance arrest of one of Dawson's colleagues hands them a lead as the professor had secretly been in therapy with avant-garde psychiatrist Radley, recently returned from California with new techniques to reshape personalities

programme.title: Kate Garraway's Life Stories
programme.desc: The presenter is joined by comedian, performer and author Ruby Wax. Kate looks back at her acting, presenting career, and how her writing talent has created some of the most memorable characters in comedy. Colombia won their group ahead of Morocco, Germany and South Korea and edged past Jamaica 1-0 in the previous round. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Karen Carney and Eni Aluko pitchside reports by Katie Shanahan, Ian Wright and Jill Scott, and commentary by Emma Hayes and Seb Hutchinson

Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Jim Parsons, Rihanna, Steve Martin and Jennifer Lopez

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
programme.desc: British wizard Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York City with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released after an inadvertent switching of suitcases with a baker. With a strange, dark force terrorising the Big Apple, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel written for the screen by JK Rowling, starring Eddie Redmayne, with Katherine Waterston, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Jon Voight, Dan Fogler and Carmen Ejogo

programme.desc: British holiday-makers jet off on a package holiday to the Spanish resort of Elsbels. Unluckily, not only is the hotel short of staff, but it also has no walls, ceilings or entertainment. Further mishaps leave the tourists fuming - until they sample a local punch laced with an aphrodisiac. Comedy, with Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack is taken hostage while interviewing a suspect, but somehow manages to talk his way out of trouble - quite an achievement for a man whose lack of tact is legendary. Having experienced what it's like to look down a gun barrel, he barges into a nearby Army camp where investigators are trying to solve a soldier's murder, but finds his help isn't appreciated. With David Jason, Bruce Alexander, Sam Kelly, Nicholas Jones and Saira Todd

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A local gigolo is murdered, forcing Jack to face the uncomfortable fact that some women are willing to pay for sex - and triggering an investigation that takes him into the seedy world of male escorts and their clientele. David Jason stars as the old-fashioned copper, with Isla Blair, Russell Hunter, Joanna David and Martin Jarvis

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Midsomer resident and biscuit factory boss Eric Calder leads Barnaby and Nelson to Copenhagen. The pair join forces with local detectives Birgitte Poulsen and Anna Degn in the hunt for the killer, and during the course of their investigation they discover the businessman had numerous links to the capital. Anglo-Danish collaboration originally shown to mark Midsomer's 100th episode, guest starring Ann Eleonora Jorgensen (The Killing), Birgitte Hjort Sorensen (Borgen), Sanjeev Bhaskar and Joanna Scanlan, alongside Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival, the unveiling of a newly discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime writer George Summersbee is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and local artist Suzie Colebrooke is electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new father Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer? With Fiona Dolman, Tamzin Malleson, Liberty Mills, Una Stubbs and Georgia Taylor

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death by a giant box during a magic show organised by famous illusionist Gideon Latimer, pathologist Kate discovers the cables had been deliberately sabotaged. Evangelising curate Andrew Maplin claims the tragedy is God's vengeance for the pagan traditions still held deep in Midsomer Oaks, but Barnaby and Nelson fear Gideon was the real target. Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee and Tamzin Malleson star in the murder mystery, with Joe Absolom, Andrew-Lee Potts, Justin Salinger, Amanda Burton and Stephanie Leonidas

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The detective's latest case presents him with a baffling conundrum in the shape of two seemingly random murders, with the victims coming from very different ends of the social spectrum - one is a countess, and the other a showgirl. His investigation soon reveals a dark secret that is an unexpected connection between the two women, both of whom have past experiences involving the same hotel in Nice. Rowan Atkinson makes his fourth appearance as the French detective from Georges Simenon's series of novels

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Called to the home of an elderly couple who haven't been seen for a while, Janet discovers Eunice Bevan's severed head at the bottom of the stairs, her body at the top, and her husband Joe in bed, emaciated and barely able to speak. Meanwhile, the detective puts her house on the market, admitting her relationship with Ade is over, and three months in to Rachel's marriage to traffic cop Sean, she's starting to feel a little claustrophobic. George Costigan and Nicola Walker guest star, with Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Lady Devereaux invites Simon to captain her staff cricket team against the rival side led by bookie Bernie Miller. However, he soon discovers the other members of the team don't exactly have a spring in their step. Donald Sinden stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsy's Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The Cornish copper looks into a lone yachtswoman's mysterious disappearance. He learns she had been receiving threats from the owners of a local china clay works - where he later makes a grisly discovery. Jack Shepherd stars, with Con O'Neill and Michael Attwell

programme.title: Carry On Girls (1973)
programme.desc: The council of a seaside town is in dire need of a means to attract tourists to its resort, so announces a beauty contest. While the conniving organiser plots a series of publicity stunts, an outraged feminist group plans to sabotage the event. Comedy, starring Sid James, June Whitfield, Joan Sims, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Bresslaw and Peter Butterworth

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Morwenna's parents Jack and Tara pay a surprise visit, having been working as missionaries in Kenya. However, the reunion is tinged with sadness when it turns out that Morwenna's mother has liver cancer, and has decided against treatment because of her faith. Louisa's first online call for her new course does not go as planned - especially when Martin tells the lecturer exactly what he thinks - and Joe investigates a break-in at the school where nothing has been stolen. Martin Clunes stars in the comedy drama, with Jessica Ransom, Caroline Catz, John Marquez, Kevin Doyle and Rebecca Lacey

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa has problems at school with Toby, Angela Sim's nephew. Meanwhile, Al has a 'Large Whiskey' order and has to ask Bert for some help, and Mrs Tishell seems to be having a delayed onset of mourning. Elsewhere, Martin and Louisa decide to try Mel's suggestions of using amber beads to help James while he is teething

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are invited to help create an Arabian-style garden in Malaga. Before long, a local resident is found dead, and a mysterious landowner is the chief suspect. When it transpires that someone has blocked the mountainside channels on which the new garden will rely for its supply of water, it appears the precious commodity may provide a motive for the killing. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Judi Dench's Wild Borneo Adventure
programme.desc: The actress journeys more than 560km down Borneo's Kinabatangan river and along the island's coastline to explore the unique wildlife that lives in this threatened environment. With scientist Kerisha Kntayya, Judi joins a crocodile hunt with a difference. Kerisha plucks young crocodiles out of the water. Judi then joins Kerisha's team as they wrestle an adult croc as part of the study Kerisha hopes will help save these prehistoric creatures. The Oscar winner, who's had a fascination with bats from an early age, also explores the Gomantong cave, home to more than a million bats

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As Joanna's Silk Road Adventure draws to a close, she travels across the Central Asian states of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. Starting in the Kyzylkum desert, she explores the citadel of Khiva, a town infamous for its history of slavery. A high-speed train then whisks her to the magnificent 14th-century architecture of Samarkand, before heading to mountainous Kyrgyzstan, where she meets DJs, K-Pop groups, eagle hunters and yak herders. Finally, her journey ends near the Chinese border, at the old Silk Road caravanserai of Tash Rabat

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The discovery of a 2,000-year-old body provides fresh evidence in a five-year-old unsolved missing persons case, so Morse and Thursday take up the investigation, discovering a possible link to a local pagan ritual to celebrate the harvest. The investigation leads them to a nuclear power station, where they face a conspiracy of silence concerning an experimental new reactor and a potential disaster that could devastate Oxford. Guest starring Sheila Hancock, widow of original Inspector Morse star John Thaw

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: After finding Alfred on the doorstep of Bellamy House, Rose shelters him in a storeroom and gives him food. When Hudson learns of the former footman's presence, his story is investigated - but all the staff below stairs are threatened by what transpires

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Timid new student nurse Faye Clark is faced with a trying first day when a model collapses after taking magic mushrooms. Lizzie falls for an injured motorcycle stuntman who is convinced he is destined to live fast and die young due to a hereditary condition - but Ormerod comes up with a different diagnosis. Hospital drama, starring Robert Daws, Neil McDermott, Lauren Drummond and Gareth Hale

programme.desc: Dr Weatherill and Sister Brigid take the Ormerod children on a family day out to Peasholm Park to see a naval re-enactment show, but the trip ends in disaster. Starring Amy Robbins, Linda Armstrong, Neil McDermott and Michelle Hardwick

programme.desc: Walker is forced to confront his past when he undertakes his own unofficial investigation into a series of violent robberies around Aidensfield. Jonathan Kerrigan, Sophie Ward, Oliver Montgomery and David Lonsdale star

programme.desc: Bellamy and Walker hunt for a batch of stolen Russian icons, and suspect the victim of an assault at the Aidensfield Arms might be involved when they discover his criminal connections. Vernon embarks on another hare-brained scheme when he meets an Italian truffle salesman, while Helen is puzzled by a youngster's baffling medical history. Guest starring David Dickinson as antiques dealer Crispin Jones, with Mark Jordon, Jonathan Kerrigan and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.desc: Emily offers comfort when an anguished Marlon breaks down, but he misreads her motherly gesture. Baby Noah continues to fight for survival

programme.desc: Relations between Curly and Emma reach an all-time low, and Sunita feels confused when Dev suddenly decides to ask her out

programme.desc: Gossip spreads like wildfire after Curly locks Emma out of the house, and Sunita thinks she has been stood up by Dev

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: New broom Sgt Miller (John Duttine) introduces a rapid response car but his big city ideas receive a cool reception from the Aidensfield watch. Walker is beaten up by hoodlums but falls for nurse Clare Owen during his stay in hospital

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Walker receives a tempting offer from an old friend, but as the proposition involves a spot of rule-bending on his part, the decision to go through with it could land him in serious trouble, especially as Sgt Miller already seems less than impressed by the policeman's rebellious nature. Rural drama starring, Jonathan Kerrigan, John Duttine and Mark Jordon

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The newly promoted Detective Sergeant Morse investigates when a famous international thief tries to steal a Faberge egg from an auction. The case leads to the gruesome murders of an academic and a gangster, and Morse is convinced the deaths are the work of the same man. As he struggles with his new responsibilities, he finds himself forced to mentor a younger partner (played by Poldark's Lewis Peek)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the child's grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: When the body of a teenage girl who went missing at the turn of the millennium is found at a building site off the M1, four old schoolfriends are placed under the spotlight and their relationships are tested to the limit. With Alex Jennings, Kevin R McNally, Neil Morrissey and James Fleet

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Oliver takes up Simon's challenge to learn judo - but the antique dealer quickly finds himself regretting his impetuousness. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The discovery of a woman's body in a car park presents Jack Frost with another challenge to his deductive powers. Delving into the victim's electronic organiser, he learns she was connected with a local religious community - and realises someone in the congregation is more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and John Lyons

programme.title: Carry On Abroad (1972)
programme.desc: British holiday-makers jet off on a package holiday to the Spanish resort of Elsbels. Unluckily, not only is the hotel short of staff, but it also has no walls, ceilings or entertainment. Further mishaps leave the tourists fuming - until they sample a local punch laced with an aphrodisiac. Comedy, with Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack is taken hostage while interviewing a suspect, but somehow manages to talk his way out of trouble - quite an achievement for a man whose lack of tact is legendary. Having experienced what it's like to look down a gun barrel, he barges into a nearby Army camp where investigators are trying to solve a soldier's murder, but finds his help isn't appreciated. With David Jason, Bruce Alexander, Sam Kelly, Nicholas Jones and Saira Todd

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A local gigolo is murdered, forcing Jack to face the uncomfortable fact that some women are willing to pay for sex - and triggering an investigation that takes him into the seedy world of male escorts and their clientele. David Jason stars as the old-fashioned copper, with Isla Blair, Russell Hunter, Joanna David and Martin Jarvis

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Midsomer resident and biscuit factory boss Eric Calder leads Barnaby and Nelson to Copenhagen. The pair join forces with local detectives Birgitte Poulsen and Anna Degn in the hunt for the killer, and during the course of their investigation they discover the businessman had numerous links to the capital. Anglo-Danish collaboration originally shown to mark Midsomer's 100th episode, guest starring Ann Eleonora Jorgensen (The Killing), Birgitte Hjort Sorensen (Borgen), Sanjeev Bhaskar and Joanna Scanlan, alongside Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival, the unveiling of a newly discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime writer George Summersbee is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and local artist Suzie Colebrooke is electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new father Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer? With Fiona Dolman, Tamzin Malleson, Liberty Mills, Una Stubbs and Georgia Taylor

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death by a giant box during a magic show organised by famous illusionist Gideon Latimer, pathologist Kate discovers the cables had been deliberately sabotaged. Evangelising curate Andrew Maplin claims the tragedy is God's vengeance for the pagan traditions still held deep in Midsomer Oaks, but Barnaby and Nelson fear Gideon was the real target. Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee and Tamzin Malleson star in the murder mystery, with Joe Absolom, Andrew-Lee Potts, Justin Salinger, Amanda Burton and Stephanie Leonidas

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The detective's latest case presents him with a baffling conundrum in the shape of two seemingly random murders, with the victims coming from very different ends of the social spectrum - one is a countess, and the other a showgirl. His investigation soon reveals a dark secret that is an unexpected connection between the two women, both of whom have past experiences involving the same hotel in Nice. Rowan Atkinson makes his fourth appearance as the French detective from Georges Simenon's series of novels

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Called to the home of an elderly couple who haven't been seen for a while, Janet discovers Eunice Bevan's severed head at the bottom of the stairs, her body at the top, and her husband Joe in bed, emaciated and barely able to speak. Meanwhile, the detective puts her house on the market, admitting her relationship with Ade is over, and three months in to Rachel's marriage to traffic cop Sean, she's starting to feel a little claustrophobic. George Costigan and Nicola Walker guest star, with Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon learns the property next to the antique shops is being sold to a fast food chain and that the deal is being handled by oily estate agent Brimley, with whom he was at school. Brimley claims he will only reconsider the sale if Simon and Oliver pay him a hefty bribe, but when it transpires he is having an extramarital affair, the duo hold the upper hand

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Lady Devereaux invites Simon to captain her staff cricket team against the rival side led by bookie Bernie Miller. However, he soon discovers the other members of the team don't exactly have a spring in their step. Donald Sinden stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsy's Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The Cornish copper looks into a lone yachtswoman's mysterious disappearance. He learns she had been receiving threats from the owners of a local china clay works - where he later makes a grisly discovery. Jack Shepherd stars, with Con O'Neill and Michael Attwell

programme.title: Carry On Girls (1973)
programme.desc: The council of a seaside town is in dire need of a means to attract tourists to its resort, so announces a beauty contest. While the conniving organiser plots a series of publicity stunts, an outraged feminist group plans to sabotage the event. Comedy, starring Sid James, June Whitfield, Joan Sims, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Bresslaw and Peter Butterworth

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Morwenna's parents Jack and Tara pay a surprise visit, having been working as missionaries in Kenya. However, the reunion is tinged with sadness when it turns out that Morwenna's mother has liver cancer, and has decided against treatment because of her faith. Louisa's first online call for her new course does not go as planned - especially when Martin tells the lecturer exactly what he thinks - and Joe investigates a break-in at the school where nothing has been stolen. Martin Clunes stars in the comedy drama, with Jessica Ransom, Caroline Catz, John Marquez, Kevin Doyle and Rebecca Lacey

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa has problems at school with Toby, Angela Sim's nephew. Meanwhile, Al has a 'Large Whiskey' order and has to ask Bert for some help, and Mrs Tishell seems to be having a delayed onset of mourning. Elsewhere, Martin and Louisa decide to try Mel's suggestions of using amber beads to help James while he is teething

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are invited to help create an Arabian-style garden in Malaga. Before long, a local resident is found dead, and a mysterious landowner is the chief suspect. When it transpires that someone has blocked the mountainside channels on which the new garden will rely for its supply of water, it appears the precious commodity may provide a motive for the killing. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Judi Dench's Wild Borneo Adventure
programme.desc: The actress journeys more than 560km down Borneo's Kinabatangan river and along the island's coastline to explore the unique wildlife that lives in this threatened environment. With scientist Kerisha Kntayya, Judi joins a crocodile hunt with a difference. Kerisha plucks young crocodiles out of the water. Judi then joins Kerisha's team as they wrestle an adult croc as part of the study Kerisha hopes will help save these prehistoric creatures. The Oscar winner, who's had a fascination with bats from an early age, also explores the Gomantong cave, home to more than a million bats

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As Joanna's Silk Road Adventure draws to a close, she travels across the Central Asian states of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. Starting in the Kyzylkum desert, she explores the citadel of Khiva, a town infamous for its history of slavery. A high-speed train then whisks her to the magnificent 14th-century architecture of Samarkand, before heading to mountainous Kyrgyzstan, where she meets DJs, K-Pop groups, eagle hunters and yak herders. Finally, her journey ends near the Chinese border, at the old Silk Road caravanserai of Tash Rabat

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The discovery of a 2,000-year-old body provides fresh evidence in a five-year-old unsolved missing persons case, so Morse and Thursday take up the investigation, discovering a possible link to a local pagan ritual to celebrate the harvest. The investigation leads them to a nuclear power station, where they face a conspiracy of silence concerning an experimental new reactor and a potential disaster that could devastate Oxford. Guest starring Sheila Hancock, widow of original Inspector Morse star John Thaw

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: After finding Alfred on the doorstep of Bellamy House, Rose shelters him in a storeroom and gives him food. When Hudson learns of the former footman's presence, his story is investigated - but all the staff below stairs are threatened by what transpires

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Timid new student nurse Faye Clark is faced with a trying first day when a model collapses after taking magic mushrooms. Lizzie falls for an injured motorcycle stuntman who is convinced he is destined to live fast and die young due to a hereditary condition - but Ormerod comes up with a different diagnosis. Lauren Drummond, Michelle Hardwick, James Daffern and Robert Daws star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A cancer patient dies unexpectedly after a visit from Dr Ormerod and the grieving family points the finger at him - leading to his arrest on suspicion of murder. Dr Ellis holds a clinic at the prison and becomes trapped when a riot breaks out, while Faye has to overcome her fear of needles to give Jack a tetanus shot. Hospital drama, starring Robert Daws, Neil McDermott, Lauren Drummond and Gareth Hale

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: When he learns Oliver has retained most of the profits from deals done on his behalf, Simon considers suing his rival. Comedy, with Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A secret from Jean's past resurfaces when the wife of an ex-lover turns up at the hospital and makes an accusation. Dr Weatherill and Sister Brigid deal with a married couple who barely know each other, but are about to have a baby, while Alun finally gets a girlfriend - until Jack destroys her ice-cream van by mistake. Starring Glynis Barber, Amy Robbins, Linda Armstrong, Andy Wear and Gareth Hale

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Weatherill and Sister Brigid take the Ormerod children on a family day out to Peasholm Park to see a naval re-enactment show, but the trip ends in disaster. Meanwhile, Dr Ellis risks getting too involved with a patient who is in trouble with the law, and Lizzie sets out to improve her career prospects. Starring Amy Robbins, Linda Armstrong, Neil McDermott and Michelle Hardwick

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Walker is forced to confront his past when he undertakes his own unofficial investigation into a series of violent robberies around Aidensfield. Helen has to come to terms with the fact that her marriage is probably over when Matthew's mistress appears in the village, and David finds himself involved in some shady behaviour. Jonathan Kerrigan, Sophie Ward, Oliver Montgomery and David Lonsdale star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy and Walker hunt for a batch of stolen Russian icons, and suspect the victim of an assault at the Aidensfield Arms might be involved when they discover his criminal connections. Vernon embarks on another hare-brained scheme when he meets an Italian truffle salesman, while Helen is puzzled by a youngster's baffling medical history. Guest starring David Dickinson as antiques dealer Crispin Jones, with Mark Jordon, Jonathan Kerrigan and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.desc: Emily offers comfort when an anguished Marlon breaks down, but he misreads her motherly gesture. Baby Noah continues to fight for survival

programme.desc: Charity finally discovers the identity of Noah's father, Donna receives disturbing news in the post and Jarvis makes a shocking discovery about Edna's grandmother on the internet

programme.desc: The newly promoted Detective Sergeant Morse investigates when a famous international thief tries to steal a Faberge egg from an auction. programme.title: World Series of Darts
programme.desc: Action from day two of the sixth round of the series, which took place at WIN Entertainment Centre in Wollongong, Australia, where the quarter-finals, semi-finals and final were all scheduled to take place in this session. Jonny Clayton was crowned champion in 2022, first overcoming current world title-holder Michael Smith in the last eight, before losing just two more legs in total in emphatic victories over Joe Cullen and James Wade in the semi-finals and showpiece match respectively. Commentary by Stuart Pyke, Mark Webster and Dan Dawson

programme.desc: A selection of the best World Cup Goals through the years - beginning with Geoff Hurst's hat-trick for England in 1966, right up to the 2018 World Cup in Russia

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: On the Canada-US border lies a vast lake that hides a dark history. For Native Americans it's an ancient and sacred site, but recently something has risen up from the depths to attack swimmers, and stories abound of an invasion of primordial bloodsuckers. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade plunges into the heart of a waterfall in the Pacific Northwest on a mission to catch the oldest river monster of his career

With an introduction by Gabriel Clarke and commentary from Brian Moore

programme.title: Live LaLiga
programme.desc: Getafe v Barcelona (Kick-off 8.30pm). Semra Hunter presents coverage of the opening match of the Spanish top-flight campaign for both teams, held at Coliseum Alfonso Perez. Barca are the reigning champions, having finished an impressive 10 points clear of rivals Real Madrid last season. Getafe ended the season in 15th place, with a four-match unbeaten run in their final fixtures saving them from relegation. With analysis from Guillem Balague and Albert Ferrer, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Terry Gibson

programme.title: Rambo: First Blood Part II (1985)
programme.desc: Incarcerated Special Forces veteran John Rambo is offered the chance for freedom by former commander Colonel Trautman if he takes up the offer to return to the jungles of Vietnam on a life-or-death mission to rescue American PoWs. During the course of the operation, he develops strong feelings for his guide, a female freedom fighter - but tragedy strikes, leaving him more determined than ever to exact a bloody and explosive revenge. Action adventure sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Julia Nickson-Soul, Steven Berkoff, George Kee Cheung, Andy Wood and Martin Kove

During the course of the operation, he develops strong feelings for his guide, a female freedom fighter - but tragedy strikes, leaving him more determined than ever to exact a bloody and explosive revenge. Action adventure sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Julia Nickson-Soul, Steven Berkoff, George Kee Cheung, Andy Wood and Martin Kove

programme.title: Death Wish V: The Face of Death (1994)
programme.desc: A former vigilante tries to settle down and start a new life under an assumed name with his fashion designer fiancee, who is being menaced by gangsters. When the thugs disfigure and ultimately murder her and the police are helpless to act, he breaks out his guns one more time. Thriller sequel, with Charles Bronson, Lesley-Anne Down, Robert Joy and Michael Parks

Shaggy Scooby and Alton are good friends (mostly because they will happily eat any experimental scientific food experiment Alton comes up with). Alton Brown is on the trail of his ancestor mad scientist Dr. Cornelius Frankenfooder! It's said he made a crazy Monster from animated foodstuffs that haunts this old castle to this day. Mr. Brown has to get to the bottom of this familial mystery. Obviously our gang is on board to help. Come for the kooky scientific food creations. Stay for the horrible monster! programme.desc: Bar manager Chris and hairdresser Gary have only been in Benidorm a week, but they have already found the perfect apartment and are now looking for work. But Chris has something else on his mind, which involves asking his boyfriend a special question. The documentary also catches up with Linda, who runs a dog rescue charity, and introduces Bradford-born Chris, who has turned his love of buying-and-selling into opening an antique and second-hand furniture shop

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: The opening night of Dave and Tony's Mexican restaurant looks like being a washout when the rain pours down - and the weather doesn't exactly help mother-and-daughter bar owners Lisa and Tia when they advertise a Friday night barbecue. Dog rescuer Linda is worried about sick pup Donny, while Sheffield retirees Phil and Jackie - known for their colourful, matching outfits - scour the charity shops for more crazy clothing bargains

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Katie-Louise, who runs a buy-and-sell website for expats, is on a mission to persuade businesses to donate for a charity auction to play out live on the radio. Meanwhile, Geoff, who has become the very first Mr Whippy of Benidorm, having bought a van and fitted it out with a soft ice cream machine, faces a potentially terminal problem when his generator blows up

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Another glimpse into the lives of expats who have left the UK for a new life in the Spanish sun. Cabaret star Mark - who appears on stage as Ruby Rox - films a video to play as part of his show, and sisters Vina and Nilam launch a business selling spice kits so expats can make their own curries. Tattoo artists Blane and Mark are in need of more customers, while retiree and metal detector enthusiast Stan spends his evenings searching the beaches for small change

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Traversing the Baltic on board the Viking Sky, Jane takes full advantage of the ship's amenities. Her first stop is Tallinn in Estonia, a medieval town with much ancient architecture. Next up is St Petersburg in Russia, where Jane heads to the Hermitage Museum, hoping to spot the cats that traditionally live in the basement. The third stop is Helsinki in Finland, where Jane meets a woman whose ambition is to kiss a brown bear. Finally, the ship pulls into the Swedish capital of Stockholm for one of the highlights of the singer's journey - a guided tour around the Abba Museum

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: When All-Inclusive Holidays Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: From endless food and drink to hotels with kids' clubs and water parks, going all-inclusive is supposed to be all about hassle-free fun in the sun. But for some, this option proves anything but relaxing. Here cameras follow the unlucky holidaymakers whose breaks went horribly wrong. They include nurse Julia Vaughan, who spent more than 5,500 on a relaxing break in Crete for herself and her family, only to be confronted by a giant construction site next to their hotel

programme.title: Beatrice and Eugenie: Surviving Controversy
programme.desc: A profile of the sisters, who have been vilified, mocked, satirised and trolled for their clothes, looks, privilege and holidays, but probably most of all for simply being the children of the Duke and Duchess of York. The documentary looks at how close to reality public perception of the princesses actually is, with archive footage and interviews with royal insiders and people who know them

programme.title: Buckingham Palace with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: The actor looks at how a grief-stricken Queen Victoria fled the palace after Prince Albert died in 1861, revealing how the government persuaded her to return for the residence's first-ever public garden party in 1868. Elsewhere, Raksha Dave tracks down the first flushing toilet installed at the palace, and JJ Chalmers struggles to learn Queen Victoria's favourite waltz

programme.title: The Curse of the Spencers
programme.desc: Documentary examining the difficult upbringing of Diana, Princess of Wales, exploring how her parents' explosive relationship shaped the child who would become a global icon. Combining insights from those closest to the family with powerful reconstruction of some of the most defining and dramatic moments of their lives, the programme uncover the striking parallels between Diana's love story and her parents', and how both troubled relationships unfolded and ended in tragedy

programme.title: Top of the Pops: Most Shocking Moments
programme.desc: The dark side of the long-running music show, exploring the ruthless tactics of promoters and the demands of big name stars, the artists that admitted to performing drunk on-air, and how one presenter hosted the show drugged. Featuring contributions from former presenters Pete Murray, 'Diddy' David Hamilton and Tony Dortie, Pan's People dancer Dee Dee Wilde, Arthur Brown, Cheryl Baker from Bucks Fizz, and backstage crew from across the decades

Meanwhile, Historic Royal Palaces chief curator Tracy Borman investigates the bridges that connect the Tower to the south side of the Thames, including London Bridge and Tower Bridge

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: A focus on the events of June 2022, which saw the Platinum Jubilee weekend and the celebration of Elizabeth II's 70 years on the throne. In the Tower's gift shop, sales assistant and royal superfan Allen Jones has been doing a roaring trade in Jubilee memorabilia. Meanwhile, senior official General the Lord Nicholas Houghton is preparing to retire. He reflects on his time living in such an extraordinary building

programme.title: Prince Albert: Consort & Confidante
programme.desc: Drama-documentary charting the life of Queen Victoria's husband, examining his role as a driving force behind the industrial revolution, a leading influence on British culture, and a campaigner for the welfare of the country's working class communities. As nine pregnancies took their toll on the queen's health, Albert was driven to take up a far more active role until his early death at the age of 42

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: A visit to the oldest ice-cream parlour in Weymouth, where Fulvio and Aimee Figliolini are carrying on the family tradition, and a nearby water garden, transformed from a clay pit in the 1950s and now home to 300 varieties of water lily. Plus, the Blue Pool Nature Reserve on the Isle of Purbeck, and the Dorset Heavy Horse Farm, where Richard Street and his daughter Taya look after their family of heavy horses. Known for their size and strength, these magnificent gentle giants were relied upon for their pulling power before mechanisation took over

programme.title: Budget Hotels: Too Good to Be True?

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Wild Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Steve Backshall, Miranda Krestovnikoff, Bill Oddie and Lindsey Chapman present from their base in Northumberland's Kielder Forest as they join forces with animal experts to examine what can be done to ease the pressures on UK wildlife. In the opening episode, Peter Wright of The Yorkshire Vet fame tries to shed light on why so many seabirds have disappeared in the last 50 years. Along the way, he is treated to the sight of gannets diving for fish off Bempton Cliffs on the east coast

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Mosque
programme.desc: Meera Syal narrates a documentary going behind the scenes at the Baitul Futuh mosque in Morden, south London, home to Britain's 30,000-strong Ahmadi Muslim community. The film reveals the defining moments of life at the mosque, from finding love to committing to faith as well as looking at international celebrations and a tragedy that devastates the entire community

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice helps a student in Headingley, Leeds, make her flat more attractive to potential buyers, advising her on how to turn its slightly off-putting Gothic interior from a liability into an asset

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Nia has trouble finding the right platform at Knapford Station, and later she admits that she does not know how to read numbers

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: A pirate and his first mate try to steal a sunken ship, unaware that there is a strange creature on board

programme.title: Snoopy and Charlie Brown: The Peanuts Movie (2015)
programme.desc: The long-suffering youngster hopes his lifelong run of bad luck will come to an end when he develops a crush on a new schoolfriend. His beloved dog has more important things to worry about, as he dreams of taking to the skies in his airborne kennel. Animated comedy, with the voices of Noah Schnapp and Bill Melendez

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation (2018)
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee (1986)
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part 1 Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about the seventh film in the action-adventure series

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding (1997)
programme.desc: A food critic realises she is in love with her best friend just as he announces he is going to marry another woman. Determined to have him to herself, she heads for the wedding with the intention of sabotaging the ceremony - but persuading the groom to give up on his bride-to-be proves harder than expected. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Sister Act (1992)
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: 12 Strong (2018)
programme.desc: The story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11. Under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban. War drama, based on Doug Stanton's non-fiction book Horse Soldiers, starring Chris Hemsworth, Michael Shannon and Michael Pena

programme.title: Overlord (2018)
programme.desc: In 1944, a group of American soldiers land in an occupied French hamlet after their plane is destroyed by enemy fire. Their mission is to take out a heavily fortified Nazi radio tower hours before D-Day. However, they stumble across a mysterious Nazi lab where their bloodthirsty enemies are waiting for them. Action thriller from producer JJ Abrams, starring Jovan Adepo, Wyatt Russell and Mathilde Ollivier

programme.title: Escape from New York (1981)
programme.desc: Former special forces soldier Snake Plissken is sentenced to life on Manhattan Island, an anarchic penal colony for the most dangerous criminals. When Air Force One is hijacked and crashes there, Snake is coerced into rescuing the US president from prisoners holding him hostage. John Carpenter's sci-fi action adventure, with Kurt Russell, Donald Pleasence, Lee Van Cleef, Adrienne Barbeau and Isaac Hayes

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad (1958)
programme.desc: The heroic sailor pits his wits against an evil magician who has shrunk a princess to the size of a doll - but to break the spell, he must journey to a mysterious island inhabited by hideous monsters and find a magic lamp. Fantasy adventure, starring Kerwin Mathews, Kathryn Grant and Torin Thatcher, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

However, the kidnapper is actually a demon in human form, determined to ensure the youngster does not fulfil his destiny. Comedy fantasy adventure, starring Eddie Murphy, Charles Dance and Charlotte Lewis

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit (1993)

Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back (2016)
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Director Edward Zwick's blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Child's novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

programme.desc: An invulnerable vigilante battles a murderer with multiple personalities - only for both to be apprehended and transferred to a mental hospital. They find themselves under the care of a sinister doctor who has plans concerning their unique abilities, but also sharing the facility with a third patient, a criminal mastermind the crime fighter had encountered before, and who is soon manipulating everyone to his own ends. M Night Shyamalan's fantasy thriller, crossing over the characters from his earlier films Unbreakable and Split. Starring James McAvoy, Bruce Willis and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Custody (2017)
programme.desc: An outwardly respectable father enters a custody battle for access to his estranged family, but his ex-wife and children seem extremely frightened of him. Writer/director Xavier Legrand's drama, starring Lea Drucker and Denis Menochet. In French

programme.title: This Is Deaf

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia (2007)

programme.title: Megamind (2010)

Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Elephant Walk (1954)

Comedy based on the TV series, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, Bill Pertwee, Ian Lavender and Arnold Ridley

Drama based on the play by Robert Harling, starring Sally Field, Julia Roberts, Dolly Parton, Shirley MacLaine, Olympia Dukakis, Daryl Hannah and Sam Shepard

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard and Bernadette find it upsetting to leave baby Halley at the nursery when Bernadette returns to work at the end of her maternity leave. The gang's university colleague Bert the geologist introduces them to his attractive new girlfriend Rebecca

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is dismayed when the group spends the Thanksgiving holiday at Mrs Wolowitz's house, but hits it off with Bernadette's father. Meanwhile, Penny realises she must deal with a mistake from her past when she and Leonard have an argument. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is bothered by the attention he receives in the wake of his heavy element discovery, but is taken aback when his work is disproved by Leonard. Meanwhile, Raj makes Howard and Bernadette feel inadequate when he stays with them for a week and is the perfect house guest

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: As Dave nears his 40th birthday, Calvin offers to coach his friend for an amateur boxing tournament. Sparks fly when Marty meets a new woman at the gym

programme.title: The Neighborhood

Meanwhile, Gloria has a visit from her mum. Directed by Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta tries to add a touch of romance to an event when he invites his girlfriend Sophia (Eva Longoria) to the precinct's work trip, along with Amy's boyfriend, Teddy (Kyle Bornheimer). Meanwhile, Charles is keen to help Holt with his anniversary breakfast, and Rosa refuses to admit to Terry and Gina that she is unwell. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

Meanwhile, Gina and Boyle become concerned about their parents' relationship, and Santiago makes Holt a Christmas gift. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard confronts the man who tormented him in high school, while Penny realises she did her fair share of bullying in the past and calls the people she targeted to apologise. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.desc: Sheldon competes with Wil Wheaton (guest starring as himself) for the role of the new Professor Proton when the scientist's old TV series gets a reboot. Penny looks after Halley when Howard and Bernadette are both put on bed rest

programme.title: The Neighborhood
