programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman goes house hunting on Spain's Costa Blanca with Barnsley couple Paul and Lisa, who cannot wait to buy their first property together in the ever-popular resort of Torrevieja. They have three children and seven grandchildren wanting to visit, so the pressure is on Jasmine to find a holiday home the whole family can enjoy. With a 72,000 budget, she shows them five options - but will any measure up to their expectations?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Alison and Martin from West Sussex, who've just celebrated their silver wedding anniversary and also recently retired, believe that there's no better time to buy a holiday home on Spain's stunning Costa Dorada, where they can spend quality time with their family. With a budget of 120,000, they would ideally love to be a short walk from the beach. Expert Ben Hillman shows them five options

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: After many years of hard work, Debbie and Nick from Salford believe the time is right to buy a holiday home close to the traditional Spanish town of Dnia on the Costa Blanca. Spectacular views at the top of the couple's wish list, so armed with a budget of 150,000, Laura Hamilton sets out to line up five options for them to consider

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners of the musically themed Harmony B&B in Torquay, Devon, begin the competition, trying to prove their establishment offers the best value for money. Dutch hosts Hans MacDaniel and Monica van der Meij try to impress their guests, but it remains to be seen what they will make of wheelchair badminton, saxophones at breakfast and a controversial sausage

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest continues at Chimneys B&B in North Walsham, Norfolk, where owners Jenny and Richard Harmer's decision to use a flag as a tablecloth angers Hans MacDaniel and Monica Van Der Meij. The argument seems to abate during an afternoon canoeing session - only to resurface at breakfast the following day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Beverley Conoley and Caroline Pocklington host at the Wordsworth Hotel in Cockermouth, Cumbria. They take their guests to a spa and Hans MacDaniel happily volunteers for a spray tan, while Richard Harmer is far more uncomfortable as he finds himself on a massage table. The day ends with dinner at a nearby bistro, but Jenny Harmer complains about the temperature

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Lesley and Emily Gray play host at the Park Farm Guest House in Gateshead, but while the evening's entertainment featuring a ride on a two-wheeled personal transporter goes down well among the guests, tensions simmer when the dinner conversation turns to a delicate issue

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining four teams tackle the challenges thrown at them in Chocolate Week. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Swansea, performing arts director Anthony plans a theatre-themed menu for his guests, Ross, Tula, Kola and Julie. However, straight-talking Tula tries to steal the show with a candid revelation and Julie brings the house down with some frisky fun at Kola's expense. Anthony's plans go awry in the kitchen, threatening to earn him more rotten earn tomatoes than rave reviews

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Social worker Julie plans a chilled out slumber party for the final night of the week in Swansea. programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Revival of the series in which celebrities take Fred Sirieix to experience dining at their favourite restaurants. In the first episode, Fred and Dermot O'Leary explore Puglia's food culture, visiting restaurants that celebrate Puglia's fabled cucina povera, or poor man's cooking

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany arrives by boat in Bodrum, Turkey, and gains unprecedented access to the recently unearthed tomb of the leader of a remarkable dynasty from the 4th century BCE. At Patara, she finds a building with connections to the American constitution and finds the city to be the hometown of St Nicholas, also known as Father Christmas. She also investigates exciting new developments at the world-famous site of Troy where she reveals the truth behind the tales of the Trojan War

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff at King's College Hospital treat patients on Valentine's Day, including a 53-year-old psychologist who has injured his shoulder in a motorcycle accident. His partner is abroad and he doesn't want to worry her, so he decides to keep the incident a secret. Also in the A&E department are a man with a bleed on the brain and an elderly widower who has been bitten by his dog

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Abby has had an accident at a diving pool and needs to have her head and neck scanned for serious injuries. Worried mum Nikki puts on a brave face while doctors perform tests, but dad Scott is stuck hundreds of miles away in Scotland. Meanwhile, Anne and Holton - part of a security team dealing with more than 50 incidents a month - encounter a variety of challenging patients on the night shift at King's College Hospital in London

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with Alan Carr and Josh Widdicombe taking on Joe Wilkinson and Sara Pascoe. Bill Bailey joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Ed Prophet worries about getting manure on his face, and later receives a shock. Margaret and Ruth Dugdall think the B&B's decor is poor, and Giles Beaton has a problem with a bottle of ketchup

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Will James manage to produce excellent food and keep the peace, leading him to victory?

programme.desc: A gunshot victim arrives under police guard and Dr Sarah fears that the patient could die from his injuries. Dr Jonathan treats a critical football player after an on-field collision. Nurse Lucy is worried when a pregnant patient can't feel her baby move

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.desc: How to make a tin-can dog and turn the humble loo roll into a host of fun and friendly animals

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps John and Soussan find their perfect holiday home on Spain's Costa Calida. As well as the area's all-year round sunshine and fabulous beaches, the pair love the area's laid-back lifestyle and traditional culture and would like an apartment with a pool for when their twin grandsons come to visit. They have a budget of 75,000, so Jasmine locates five options to the pair to consider

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The return of the programme following British expats as they set up new businesses in France, Spain, Italy and Portugal. A London couple roll out plans for their new motorhome business in France, while in Spain, a couple work hard to fill their empty guest house

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting the Isle of Wight to meet a couple who have lots of unwanted militaria in their sheds. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Cumbria, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit collector Paula, who badly needs some cash to fix her leaking roof. Henry picks a Morris Minor for restoration, while Simon turns some unwanted wood into furniture that seriously impresses independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to establish the value of a Lincolnshire railway man's estate by visiting his last known address, and uncover the story of his military service in Aden, Yemen. Meanwhile, another case is complicated by a family's numerous name changes. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates are divulged

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Workaholic Alfie worries that having no phone signal will affect his business, while competitive Megan and Dick relish finding dust in the outside building

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Alfie and rival owner Megan engage in a debate about breakfasts and heating, while David and Kevin become a little emotional before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Matt and Lucia's house in Royal Wootton Bassett, Wiltshire, is bulging at the seams, as it is home to not only them but three grown-up children from previous relationships. Matt loves it but Lucia does not, so while Kirstie Allsopp tries to change the layout, Phil Spencer finds some alternative properties. But will the family choose to up sticks or stay where they are?

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow adolescent babirusa Tolo, who lives with his devoted mother Sula. They are very close, enjoying mud baths and pedicures together. But Sula has a hoof problem so they must be separated for the vet to intervene, and keepers are concerned for Tolo's wellbeing in her absence. Meanwhile, laid-back rock hyraxes Daissie and her partner Nungu are expecting their eighth litter. With the birth imminent, the couple's life of ease could be a thing of the past

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Can a father-and-son duo see past Cara the beagle's anxiety and give her a shot? The Ford family look for a new canine companion for their nervous therapy dog Lucy

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets widowed teacher Gretta, who is making a fresh start in rural Cambridgeshire with a Malaysian-inspired burnt wood and glass home being designed by her nephew Carlos and project managed by her brother-in-law Fernando - despite his lack of building experience. However, as site clearance begins, so does the Covid-19 pandemic - and family harmony is tested when an apple tree much loved by Fernando is condemned for removal by Gretta

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Food writer and Junior Bake Off judge Ravneet Gill takes Fred Sirieix to Mallorca, visiting a beach bar that is fast becoming one of the island's most exciting culinary hotspots and meeting a couple from the sleepy village of Caimari in the island's agricultural heart who are credited as being at the forefront of a movement to revive Mallorcan cuisine

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the most hidden and remote hotels on the planet. This episode visits establishments including an unusual 200-year-old building in Norfolk transformed into a luxury 100-room hotel, a South American lodge set within 17,000 hectares of rainforest, and a Swedish hotel built from a passenger plane

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Single father Gary, 47, is put in a medically induced coma at King's College Hospital to reduce the risk of brain damage following a serious motorcycle accident, and 69-year-old Steve confronts his fear of needles when a nurse has to remove a fishbone stuck in his finger. Meanwhile, 58-year-old lung cancer patient Terry is in A&E with his carer Sandy, a year after being given two weeks to live

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Maulden, Yvonne collapses with a cardiac arrest. It's a race against the clock as the heli-medics try to help. In the Peaks, medics land on top of a steep ridge to rescue Donna, who has collapsed while walking. A motorcyclist collides with a car trying to avoid ducks crossing the road and medics fear multiple fractures

programme.desc: The chef visits the home of New Nordic cuisine - Copenhagen - where he goes foraging for rosehip and learns about the art of pickling buds, bark and flowers. He's cheered to find plenty of traditional favourites, such as the city's famous Smorrebrod open sandwiches on rye bread, delicious poached turbot with cabbage and lemon butter sauce and - of course - the ubiquitous Danish pastry. Back at home, Rick cooks fried pork belly with lovage potatoes and parsley sauce, which has been voted Denmark's favourite dish

After staying overnight in a disused train station and visiting a local pub, the pair decide to challenge each other to a fishing competition the following day, where the winner gets a very special culinary treat

Not only that, but there are encounters with an aggressive bull in a field and a terrifying truck driver to endure. programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves the tracks for a nautical pilgrimage through the Thousand Islands, visiting Fort Henry in the port city of Kingston, Ontario, and learning about the antics of 19th-century high-wire walker the Great Farini in Port Hope. He then heads to Oshawa to look around the home of the McLaughlin family, who helped build a new economy for Canada, before his journey across Canada concludes in Toronto

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to explore more of the US rail network, embarking on the first leg of a journey across Alaska. He begins his journey amid the snow-capped mountains of the Kenal Peninsula, where he discovers that 150 years ago, Alaska was a Russian colony. Moving on, in Seward he feeds a rescued sea otter with a fearsome bite and in Anchorage he joins the US Arctic Warriors for parachute training

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues to explore Alaska, from the remote former goldrush settlement of Talkeetna to the railwayless state capital, Juneau. Along the way, he helps a homesteader fell a tree to clear land for a log cabin, discovers how 100 years ago photographers captured the beauty of the Alaskan landscape and meets scientists studying the Northern Lights

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The next leg of Michael Portillo's journey begins in Skagway, Alaska, where he learns about writer Jack London, one of the gold prospectors who hiked to the Klondike 100 years ago. He then crosses into Canada on the White Pass and Yukon railway. Along the way he is invited to shake his tail feathers in a grouse dance, heads for the home of the Vancouver Giants, tries his hand at ice hockey and visits the Canadian Motion Picture Park

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores British Columbia, discovering how two superpowers nearly came to war over a pig and joining the Royal Canadian Navy to firefight on board the frigate HMCS Regina. He also explores the rich British heritage and colonial past of Victoria - the provincial capital of British Columbia - discovers the origins of the Hudson's Bay Company, helps to carve a 36- foot totem pole and learns how to head off a charging bear

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards one of the world's most famous trains, the Rocky Mountaineer, to cross the backbone of the North American continent from Kamloops to the spa resort of Banff. This magnificent journey takes him to the highest point of the 19th century transcontinental Canadian Pacific Railway line at Kicking Horse Pass, past Lake Louise and inside spiral tunnels blasted through the mountains. Along the way, Michael hears of the harsh and dangerous conditions endured by the Chinese and European labourers who built the railway, and looks back at the historic driving of the Last Spike, which completed the Canadian Pacific Railway in 1885

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor Meldrew finds himself forced into early retirement, but is determined not to end up on the scrapheap, pouring scorn on the modern world and driving everybody crazy in the process. Richard Wilson stars in the first-ever episode as misery guts Meldrew, with Annette Crosbie as his long-suffering wife. From 1995

programme.title: Bangers & Cash: Restoring Classics

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant explores five countries that were part of Yugoslavia, which had an extensive state-run railway network before its break-up in the 1990s and the Balkan Wars of Independence that followed. From Slovenia, Chris heads east along an old Austro-Hungarian railway that was once used by the Orient Express, pays a visit to a very unusual railway-related battlefield in Bosnia and rides on one of the world's great mountain railways on his way to the Serbian capital Belgrade before finishing his journey in Montenegro

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: How the Nazis searched for religious items. However, after their defeat, an American detachment known as The Monuments Men' found and repatriated a large proportion of the loot

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the myth of German invincibility was finally debunked by their defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Bomber Command is unable to hit its targets precisely and attacks German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, Michael Portillo rediscovers a once-famous poet in Nottingham and travels on a railway line resurrected by popular demand after falling victim to Beeching's cuts. He finds out how Doncaster rail workers shaped British political history, before reaching his final destination of Leeds, where he auditions at Britain's oldest continuously working music hall

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Wolverhampton, Michael Portillo visits Lacock Abbey near Chippenham in Wiltshire to find out how the world's first photographic negative was made. He then heads to Bristol Zoo, examines an extraordinary piece of Victorian engineering at Severn Tunnel Junction and ends the leg in Gloucester, where he meets a stonemason at the city's cathedral

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey from Southampton to the West Midlands, Michael Portillo visits the spa town of Cheltenham, where he gets behind the wheel of a very early locomotive carriage that ran on the road. In Tewkesbury, he joins a group re-enacting a battle from the Wars of the Roses, before he reaches his final destination of Wolverhampton, where he hears how Queen Victoria made an emotional visit that signalled the end of her exile from public life after mourning Prince Albert

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. Continuing his journey south-west into Essex, Michael dredges for oysters off Mersea Island before taking the train to Witham, where he discovers a model farming establishment at Tiptree. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects five beautiful veteran motorbikes from an enthusiast who is still happily riding in his 90s. A vividly coloured 1955 Nash Metropolitan brightens up the auction room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off at Woodleys Farmhouse in Woburn Sands, Buckinghamshire, where the inexperienced owner worries that breakfast will be her downfall

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eddie and Karen Deighton host their rivals at Finch Cottage in Wilsford cum Lake, Wiltshire. They pride themselves on providing a personal experience, but the lack of TVs in the rooms is a big turn-off for some guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third destination is the Bell Inn in Thorpe-le-Soken, Essex, where hospitality manager Ian Hawthorne and his fiancee Karen Hunt are confident they can satisfy their guests. But Frankie is less than pleased by the view from her room and one pair of guests are still in a bad mood over their feedback earlier in the week

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sisters Georgie Monaghan and Frankie Gallie's Frasers Guest House in Battlesbridge, Essex, is the final stop of the week's competition. Frasers boasts a unique location in an antiques district, but some guests are left questioning whether the mattresses are heirlooms too when they discover a few unappealing stains. After spending the day exploring an antiques yard, Georgie and Frankie treat their guests to milkshakes at their family-run diner. Talk soon turns to payment day, making for a tense end to the evening

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last day of the competition sees the B&Bers eager to challenge each other about the feedback they've received, as Toni from Woodleys Farmhouse wants to know how she can improve her breakfast service. When one pair accuses another of game playing, things start to get emotional before the winning B&B is announced.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Checkout assistant Jamie-Lea hosts the first of a week of dinner parties from Bristol and Bath, hoping to impress with a few tricks up her sleeve. Her guests are 32-year-old pig farmer Chris, 50-year-old retired holidaygoer Shelley, 69-year-old retired publican Christine, and 29-year-old market stall owner James

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pig farmer Chris prepares a menu showing off his love of Italy - with one of his home-reared pigs ending up on the menu - and makes a surprising revelation about his education

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired pub landlady Christine hosts the third dinner party of the week in and around Bristol, hoping to impress her competitors and win the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hummus-maker James hosts the fourth evening in and around Bristol and is confident he can beat Christine's retro meal last night. But he still has a lot to do if he is to win

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bristol, the fifth and final cook to host is 50-year-old retiree and lady of leisure Shelley, who's hoping to impress with her tried and tested favourites. She's been talking about her holidays and lifestyle throughout the week, but will ex-pub landlady Christine have to call time on the chat tonight? She will also have to win over checkout assistant Jamie-Lea, hummus entrepreneur James, and pig farmer Chris

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Almeria, Sharon and Shaun Garner help Paul and Kim Rawlings-Jackson from St Andrews in Scotland find their dream 'forever' home for their budget of 240,000 euros. Paul wants a traditional villa or finca, but his wife Kim wants something more modern for them and their beloved dog, Prince. In Alicante, Rodriguez sisters Sophie and Charlotte help doting grandparents Kevin and Sharon from Boston in Lincolnshire find a holiday home where they can relax with the whole family. Their budget stretches to 120,000 euros

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Steve and Sharon are put to the test when a former estate agent from Warrington comes looking for a spacious villa in Almeria, and a family looks for a holiday home in Alicante

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Almeria, husband-and-wife team Steve and Sharon Garner help DIY fanatic Steve McCormack and his wife Christine find a characterful property for their budget of 118,000 euros. In Alicante, mother-and-daughter duo Sophie and Linda Rodriguez are hard at work helping Scottish house-hunters Chic and Christine Harrington find their dream holiday home for their budget of 75,000 euros

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Linda and Alan Keir, who want to buy a holiday home in the Costa del Sol to escape the climate of the Scottish Highlands. They look at five properties on their budget of 150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Yvette and Agata call upon the services of Jasmine Harman in their hunt for their dream three-bed 'forever home' in the seaside town of Alvor on Portugal's Algarve. Property expert Jasmine rustles up five options for their budget of 300,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joiner Craig and wine industry worker Suzy started dating nearly nine years ago and between them have three children. After discovering the seaside town of Los Gigantes on Tenerife six years ago, they've been back many times and have now decided that it's the perfect place to buy a holiday home for all the family. To help them fulfil their dream, Jasmine Harman hunts out five great options for them to view within their 200,000 budget, but will any be the one to capture their hearts?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect meets Duncan and Josie, who are taking on an 18th-century barn perched on the edge of a pretty green, containing some very dodgy dcor including a purple striped '80s kitchen and a miniature kitchen extension built to house a washing machine. Duncan and Josie need to make it liveable very quickly as they welcome their new baby Ruby, so George sets out to make the dark, cramped layout work for modern family living. He also heads to Southport, Merseyside, to see a Victorian gothic property in need of attention. Owners Jenny and Fadi are keen to resore the pile to its original splendor

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Mary Martin and Carl Turner want to build a home that resembles a giant stack of glass cubes in Brixton, south London. The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

However, Adam faced a tournament of hard-hitting rugby mayhem, one that tested his limits further than ever before

Two high risk football matches are put under drone surveillance as rival fans threaten to cause mayhem on the streets of Wolverhampton. The unit is deployed to a park in the early hours when a 999 call reports a group of people trying to bury a body

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to reports of a man collapsed in the street and in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, he's surrounded by police officers who've been carrying out CPR. She's hoping that her pan-fried chicken with a white wine and lemon sauce will be a match made in heaven with the food jury, but chef Frederick Forster has other ideas as he serves up his spiced duck breast. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off at The Oaks Luxury Lodges in County Londonderry. A guided tour of iconic sights goes down well, but a full Irish breakfast proves divisive

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition begins in Newquay in Cornwall, at Avalon Guest House, where the owners' taste in lime green decor does not prove as relaxing as planned for the guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Jason and Lindsay Crossland from East Yorkshire met 28 years ago when they were working for the RAF. programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.desc: Officers suspect there are drugs hidden in a man's bag, and a travelling musician, who claims to possess special powers enabling her to foretell the future, struggles to get through immigration. programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A man is caught red-handed by customs and tries to blame his travelling companion, but officials suspect they could be working together. Meanwhile, an immigration raid targets illegal workers and a swoop on a taxi rank catches the drivers with no work rights. Plus, a father and son from China have four suitcases full of undeclared food and a stimulant drug is found in picture frames that have arrived by mail

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: A spate of deaths occurs in which women turn to clay, and DNA tests suggest a computer virus is the cause. Pete and Myka try to fathom why they have woken up in bed together

programme.title: Quantum Leap
programme.desc: Sam occupies the body of a high-school student and sets out to save the youth's sister from a disastrous marriage

programme.title: Merlin

Emilia Fox (Silent Witness) guest stars alongside Bradley James and Colin Morgan

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: The crew members are impersonated by a gang of con artists, and must locate the villains before they are punished for crimes they did not commit. Sci-fi drama, starring Kate Mulgrew and Jeri Ryan

programme.desc: As the team continues to investigate the murder of an officer who was about to blow the whistle on police misconduct within NOPD, Pride must get creative in order to finally get rid of the dirty cops. programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A stray cat has been re-named Apple, but still needs a permanent home. Binky is one of the most seriously ill cats that Clare has met and 10-year-old Sparky has terminal cancer, prompting the vets to consider a homeopath potion

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Top Tens of Warfare
programme.desc: Documentary in which rarely-seen archive footage and expert interviews identify and rank history's most influential military equipment. The series begins with a look at aircraft, from the P51 Mustang through to the modern Harrier jump jet

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Rita is offered a posh Mayfair home when Nan's flat is found to be unsafe, and Harvey has a romantic evening in the country

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Fern, a beautiful blue Burmese and one of the Cat Hospital's oldest patients takes a turn for the worse. Franklin, a prize-winning Maine coon, a novice when it comes to females meets Ruby - but will romance ensue? Veterinary specialist Clare Meade meets a visiting cat called Honey

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Scottish Highlands' peaks and heather moorlands, where a mix of mammals and birds have adapted to an ecology that is unique in Britain. He waits until dawn to witness the black grouse's secretive courtship display, encounters a herd of reindeer and scales the Cairngorms to spot a mountain hare

programme.title: A Canterbury Tale (1944)
programme.desc: A land girl, an Army sergeant and a GI meet in a small Kent village during the Second World War and set out to unmask the mystery assailant conducting an unusual reign of terror against local women. Powell and Pressburger's mystery, starring Eric Portman, Sheila Sim, John Sweet, Esmond Knight and Dennis Price

programme.title: Break Out (1984)
programme.desc: Two boys on a birdwatching trip are forced to help two escaped convicts to evade the law. Children's adventure, starring David Jackson and Ian Bartholomew

programme.title: John and Julie (1953)
programme.desc: Two children are desperate to watch the coronation of Elizabeth II firsthand, so run away from home and make their way to London. As they wander the city in search of the Queen, they have a series of adventures with an assortment of eccentric characters. Comedy, starring Colin Gibson, Lesley Dudley, Peter Sellers and Sid James

programme.title: The Clue of the Missing Ape (1953)
programme.desc: Two children uncover a plot by a gang of crooks to blow up British ships that are harboured near Gibraltar. Children's adventure, starring George Cole and Nati Banda

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: This special extended episode shows what goes into the production of London's newest electric taxi

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: Andi takes the road to organise a tourist activity likely to generate essential income for the reserve. Meanwhile, game hunters visit Glen Garriff

programme.title: Boy In The Corner (2022)
programme.desc: A teenager in an impoverished neighbourhood finds his dreams crushed, pushing him towards a life of crime. Crime drama, starring Cyran Vergara and Victoria Shepherd

programme.title: South of the River (2020)
programme.desc: A singer is diagnosed with throat cancer, and must choose between his band and his medical treatment. Drama, starring Alex Gillison and Joe Watkins

programme.title: Cockneys vs Zombies (2012)
programme.desc: Two brothers plan to rob a bank to save their grandfather's retirement home. However, on the day of the heist, an ancient tomb is disturbed in London's Docklands, unleashing a horde of zombies. As the crooks fight their way through the city, the residents of the care home fight back against the besieging undead. Comedy horror, starring Harry Treadaway, Rasmus Hardiker, Richard Briers and Honor Blackman

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A stray cat wearing a cone-shaped collar turns out to be living a double life. A highly spirited cat called Charlie gets his annual check-up and a sphynx cat called Vader is treated for painful spots on his tummy

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Europe's Wilderness
programme.desc: The Bearded Vulture is one of the largest birds of prey in Europe and one of the rarest

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to explore more of the remote and fascinating places that lie off the mainland, beginning with a cluster of islands in the Outer Hebrides. He starts his journey just off the coast of North Uist at Berneray, then heads south to Grimsay and Kirkibost, before ending on the deserted whisky island of Pabbay

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton journeys around the coast of the Long Island of Harris and Lewis, beginning on Scarp, travelling north to Great Bernera, then south east to Scalpay. These islands may seem to exist in the shadow of their much larger neighbours, but Paul discovers they have a distinct identity all of their own, as he hears remarkable stories of crofter rebellions, rocket mail and a rich local culture

programme.title: Last Holiday (1950)
programme.desc: A man believes he has a terminal disease, prompting him to embark on a final fling abroad. Comedy, starring Alec Guinness and Kay Walsh

programme.title: The Shop at Sly Corner (1947)
programme.desc: An ex-convict murders his blackmailing book-keeper in an effort to protect his violinist daughter's blossoming career. Thriller, starring Oscar Homolka, Muriel Pavlow, Derek Farr and Irene Handl

programme.title: Black Jack (1979)
programme.desc: A rascally French sailor is saved from hanging in 18th-century Yorkshire and sets out on the road with an apprentice, rescuing a young girl from an asylum along the way. Ken Loach's period adventure, adapted from Leon Garfield's classic children's novel, starring Jean Franval, Stephen Hirst, Andrew Bennett and Louise Cooper

programme.title: Break Out (1984)
programme.desc: Two boys on a birdwatching trip are forced to help two escaped convicts to evade the law. Children's adventure, starring David Jackson and Ian Bartholomew

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: When Koening is forced to crash land his ship, he finds himself stranded on a strange moon. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed goes undercover to investigate whether a series of murders is linked to the activities of a marriage bureau. Starring Patrick Macnee, Diana Rigg, and guest star Patrick Cargill

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: Families reveal the moment their lives changed forever - when they were told their missing loved ones had been murdered

programme.title: Let Him Have It (1991)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial 1952 murder trial in which 19-year-old Derek Bentley was sentenced to be hanged for killing a policeman - even though his friend Chris Craig was the one who fired the fatal gunshot. Starring Christopher Eccleston, Paul Reynolds, Tom Courtenay, Eileen Atkins, Tom Bell and Mark McGann

programme.title: Radio On (1979)
programme.desc: A DJ drives from London to Bristol to investigate his brother's death, encountering a succession of strange people along the way - but his interest in solving the mystery begins to wane as the journey unfolds. Road movie, starring David Beames, Lisa Kreuzer and Sting

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: A rookie cop interviews imprisoned cannibal Dr Genghis. At the same time, a man obsessed with serial killers records a video diary. Starring Adrian Edmondson

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital

programme.title: UBOS
programme.desc: Cassy, Vern & Gus are gifted students who go to an enchanted school to learn about magic. After receiving a book named UBOS (Ultimate Book of Spells) they soon begin their journey of a lifetime

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force
programme.desc: Jack Holister is an extraordinary skydiver who leads a group of vigilante crime fighters known as the Skysurfer Strike Force. who must try to seek out and defeat the robotic Cybron

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: John Mannering does a deal with a crooked insurance agent in order to recover an Aztec mask worth a hundred thousand pounds from an ex-convict

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Harvey is given the brush-off by his son's schoolteacher, and Lou is forced to spend time recovering

programme.title: Italy Made With Love
programme.desc: An intimate look into Italian culture, where we find the hidden treasures in each unique region and let the locals share their stories, heritage and culture, as only they can

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: A workman arrives to fix a hole in the space-time continuum, leaving Gary facing a dilemma of epic proportions concerning which life - and indeed which wife - to plump for. Meanwhile, Ron thinks he has a lucrative business deal on the cards. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: An evil demon and three witches plot to kill the disciples in a bid to bring themselves back to life. Cult adventure series, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: Appointment in London (1952)
programme.desc: Over the course of one month in 1943, an intense rivalry develops between an overworked wing commander and an American officer - but the two try to put aside personal feelings for the sake of the war effort. Second World War drama, starring Dirk Bogarde, Bryan Forbes, Dinah Sheridan and William Sylvester

programme.title: John and Julie (1953)
programme.desc: Two children are desperate to watch the coronation of Elizabeth II firsthand, so run away from home and make their way to London. As they wander the city in search of the Queen, they have a series of adventures with an assortment of eccentric characters. Comedy, starring Colin Gibson, Lesley Dudley, Peter Sellers and Sid James

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Poplar for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: When Koening is forced to crash land his ship, he finds himself stranded on a strange moon. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Europe's Wilderness
programme.desc: A journey of discovery to a wonderful world of breath-taking views and endangered species with each episode focusing on one animal and its lifestyle, needs and habitat

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie starts an unusual business - a shop that specialises in selling useless merchandise. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Pauline Yates and Tim Preece

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Nineteen Nineteen (1985)
programme.desc: Two former patients of Sigmund Freud meet again and discuss the psychiatric treatment they underwent 65 years earlier. Period drama, starring Paul Scofield and Maria Schell

programme.title: United (2011)
programme.desc: Drama charting the story of the 'Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott

programme.title: Cockneys vs Zombies (2012)
programme.desc: Two brothers plan to rob a bank to save their grandfather's retirement home. However, on the day of the heist, an ancient tomb is disturbed in London's Docklands, unleashing a horde of zombies. As the crooks fight their way through the city, the residents of the care home fight back against the besieging undead. Comedy horror, starring Harry Treadaway, Rasmus Hardiker, Richard Briers and Honor Blackman

programme.title: A Touch of Love (1969)
programme.desc: A single mother is determined to go it alone in spite of the social stigma and practical problems in her path. Drama, starring Sandy Dennis and Ian McKellen

Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings
